review.reviewBody: I normally wear size XL gloves, so I ordered these but they were too tight. I exchanged them for a pair of XXL but the fingers are still too tight. review.reviewBody: It is a perfect hiking jacket, it is very light and breathable.
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is perfect for early mornings and late finishes on shoulder seasons. I've had it for a couple of months now and it's been a permanent resident in my climbing backpack. I'll usually start out approaches with it and then it'll pack away very compactly to the bottom of the pack until I walk out at the end of the day. I'm rarely ever cold on my arms so the hybrid approach was just what I was looking for. Comfortable fit and a high quality build
review.name: Just right for shoulder seasons

review.reviewBody:
I wouldn't have purchased had the product information informed me it was made with materials with Prop 65. I know that's probably in most things these days, but still would rather avoid when it's clearly printed on the main product label....
Also, the fit wasn't great because I have a butt. 
If you have no butt/a flat butt, then you should be fine.
Seems warm and compact - wanted to have as my new go-to jacket....
review.name: Prop 65 printed on the label

name: Borrego Hybrid Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: Aether Quickdraw - 6-Pack

hasVariant.name: Aether Quickdraw - 6-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the DMM Aether Quickdraw - 6-Pack online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These biners are the dream I’ve been waiting 20+ years for…a sub 30g 2-piece keylock wire-gate. Why did it take so long? Why are they so expensive? Who knows.  I no longer care.  Once they rack up and clip out, it’s worth it. Simplest design is just two parts. Smooth nose does not snag on harness, slings, or bolts. Nose fits through many chains and pitons. Gate opening and action is grand.  1/2 the parts of the Ange, 1/3 less parts than a keylock solid gate, and oh so snappy smooth as the best wire-gates are. It’s the alpine, sport, trad, ice and mountaineering biner to rule them all. Dyneema dog bones are beautiful and clean. Finally.
review.name: The Dream

name: Aether Quickdraw - 6-Pack

review.reviewBody: After dealing with frozen feet and numb toes for a couple of winters in the Canadian Rockies, in a pair of old Nepal Evo that I bought when I started climbing, I decided to get the Nordwand 6000 High ice climbing boots. I used them last winter and found them very comfortable right away, whether I was walking or climbing. They're lightweight and the gaiters keep my feet dry and warm. These boots are super warm, maybe even too warm for a mild winter like the last one. I like how easy it is to put them on and take them off with the Boa system. I hope the cables last a long time. They fit well overall, but folks with narrow heels might find them a tiny bit loose there, but you can fix that by really tightening the cables. Also, if you have wide feet, consider going half a size up – I usually wear a size 9 but got a 9.5 based on other reviews, and it was the right call. Overall, I am very happy with these boots.
review.name: Warm, lightweight and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I don’t even own these boots but my buddy does and he brought them out to climb today for the first time. I won’t speak to their climbing abilities but the zipper caught 2x times leading to a ton of faff. literally had to cut the stuck material w/ a knife then use a v-thread tool to hook it out. After removing stuckage, we got on our climb and he wasn’t impressed w/ that either. Screw these boots
review.name: Zipper catches, had to cut it twice

review.reviewBody: Initially, I was very happy with the boot. Primary use is ice climbing, secondary is for very cold days at work.  After less than 20 total hours climbing in the boots, some of the heat-reflective film from the soles started peeling off. I don't think this will affect the overall warmth of the boot too much but it certainly is concerning. I wear a size 11 and have a wide forefoot with a narrow heel, the fit is true to size.
review.name: Very warm, overall quality is suspect.

review.reviewBody: I live in the Canadian Rockies where winters can be harsh. Those boots are amazingly light and so warm. Would highly recommend.

These boots are enought warm for canadian winter. I was scared to froze my toes while ice climbing but they keep me warm. No issue so far with the clip system and the boa are a big plus for me.

they feel a little bit smaller then my actual foot size, i would recommend going .5 bigger (for the US foot system) then your normal size.
review.name: Exaclty what i wanted

review.reviewBody:
I've had the boot for multiple seasons and really enjoy them overall. Whether its a 3 hr hike to the base of the climb or climbing technical WI5, I find the boot to be incredibly comfortable and warm. The BOA system, which I am always questioning its durability, has thus far been pretty great. It takes me 30 seconds to unzip the boot and tighten and be ready for climbing vs 5 min compared to my laced colleagues. 
My main complaint with this boot is the quality of the pull handles/straps of the outer boot and inner sock. They are not reinforced and will tear off quite easy if pulled on too hard. I have found using a shoe horn makes putting the boots on very easy and mitigates this poor design. 
The other complaint I have is the main boot insole becomes delaminated from the boot rather easy. I have had it happen twice and no matter what glue/adhesive I use to repair it has been unsuccessful. Mammut was easy to contact for replacement inserts but its still an inconvenience to bring to a cobbler for them to glue back in place properly and the layers of the insole delaminate quickly under the moisture and friction of general use. 
Both of these issue do not effect performance but is otherwise upsetting on a rather expensive boot. 
The boots do feel large on your feet at first but climb well. Fit is 1/2 size larger than shoe size but BOA system mitigates that.
review.name: Great Boot, Questionable Quality

review.reviewBody: Took this on my first mountaineering trip up Mount. Whitney. Super comfortable. Lots of room in the toe box. Very warm until the second day. I was unable to dry out the inner liner at night. I tried everything three nights in a row. Unable to get it. Dry. Toes were slightly cold putting into damp boot. The outer gator is certainly waterproof, but it also traps in humidity from your sweaty feet. I tried venting the boots during the day. I tried taking out the liners. I tried taking out the sole from the liner putting. I tried putting the liner and the soles in my sleeping bag with me at night. Nothing worked to get the liners completely dry.
review.name: Looks great, but liners don't dry overnight

review.reviewBody: Good boot, but be gentle when you put them on, inner socks looks delicate, mine ripped off.
review.name: Good boots, fit's large

review.reviewBody: Very satisfied with boot thus far. Technical ice climber. Boot performs, but is heavy and a bit overkill for most days. Have been really happy to have them on colder days in the shade, though! BOA is super nice & convenient but I wish it did offer a bit more adjustment. Boots are pretty bulky, which is expected from a boot like this. Likely wouldn't attempt too technical a mixed climb rockin these, but for your water ice days they're pretty money.
review.name: Great boot, slight overkill.

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable out of the box. Holding up great after a handful of mountaineering trips. I'd recommend these to anyone looking for a nice double boot for mountaineering

name: Nordwand 6000 High Mountaineering Boot

review.reviewBody: Only first impression but the tent / tarp seems to be well made from good materials. Sewing & craftsmanship are very good. Instructions on storage bag is thoughtful. Liked the color, although there is no floor or netting, it?s much cheaper to purchase than many Sil or PU tarps on the market & it has both. Stakes are a bit flimsy but a set of high quality pegs is only 40 bucks or so, putting the whole deal under $200 for a 2-person shelter that weighs 2lbs. For that price, I?m not gonna worry about the tent stakes.
review.name: Well made

review.reviewBody: I ordered for the reputation of the brand and quality. The helmet is great. The color was hard to find and really looks good.
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a red helmet to match my bike (yes, I admit it) and good visibility, too, I suppose, that narrowed down my choices.  This POC helmet was on sale -- still expensive, but reduced.  A friend who had a bad head injury while cycling did a lot of helmet research and recommended POC.  I liked the extra coverage in the back of the head.  So I got spent some extra and got it.  It fits my big head well and has room for a sweat cap.  The size adjustment works well.  It holds my glasses well in the slots near the temple.  It seems to have good air flow -- less dripping sweat compared to my previous helmet (a Bell).  I think it looks pretty good.  Glad I got it, would recommend it because it holds my glasses and seems to reduce sweat.
review.name: Got it in red to match my bike

review.reviewBody: Say good bye to sweat rolling down in your eyes thanks to the large air vents where they count most.
review.name: Pure White

review.reviewBody: Took a gnarly spill after crossing a wet bridge and taking the turn too fast.  Ended up getting pretty cut up and sore from the crash but this helmet saved me from at minimum a concussion and maybe something far worse.  I smacked my head as I went down and the helmet bounced off the concrete with no issues.   Thank you POC!
review.name: This Helmet basically saved my life

review.reviewBody:
I invested in this helmet because I wanted protection and comfort. First thing I noticed out of the box is how beautiful the bright orange color is. It is very noticeable even in the shades from far away. Second is how light it is in my hands, and lastly how comfortable it is on my head.
Feels true to size. I would recommend it.
review.name: Safe and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I had recently crashed and broke my helmet. This is the perfect replacement to protect my head in the future.
review.name: Great protective helmet

review.reviewBody: I've worn the POC Octal for years and really love it, decided to try the Ventral Air Mips to see if anythings new.  It feels a bit lighter and the air flow is really extraordinary.  A joy to wear.  However...  the sunglasses garage is a total fail!  So disappointing, the same feature on the Octal works like a champ.  The material in the "garage' that was formerly a little bit tacky is now like a dry felt and the sunglasses don't even stay in place for a brief look down, let alone a minor bump in the road.  Never realized how important this feature is to me until it didn't work!!  Researching a DIY work-around...
review.name: One big flaw

review.reviewBody:
I've had this helmet for about 4 months and worn it more or less daily.
The fit and finish are great.
The helmet is lightweight and has plenty of vents for breathability.
I am not sure what more out of a helmet I could want.
review.name: Love it

name: Ventral Air Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: This jacket is beautiful on!! The color and fit is perfect!!
review.name: This jacket is beautiful on!!

review.reviewBody: I love this color combo, sadly it was way too big so I’m waiting for my exchange. I like baggy so I can layer but this was overall big, like a tent. Size down.
review.name: Pretty and cozy

review.reviewBody: Highly recommend this warm cozy jacket. And it looks great too! Really love the cinch drawstring. Pockets are big and can hold a log of stuff without looking bulky.
review.name: Warm, cozy and stylish!

review.reviewBody: I wore ths out in the wind, mid- 40s, and that high-collar came in handy for warmth! I am usually between a S and a M size, the M is roomy enough to allow for layers and it does have cinches at the bottom edges. LOVE the colors, nice fleece. Will wear often.
review.name: Great colors, warm jacket

review.reviewBody: I love my fleece jacket, but unfortunately it’s a bit big on me, they didn’t have an XXS which is what I probably need. Usually I wear an XS not on this case.
review.name: I love my fleece jacket,

review.reviewBody: I was in Salt Lake on what turned out to be a rainy week and needed a jacket. The Flagship store was up the street so I stopped in and met the friendliest and turned out to be great spokesman for Cotopaxi. I immediately gravitated to th Bacano Fleece, mahogany with light blue trim. Great fit and cozy. I heard about the design studio above the store and found a great jacket and maybe an even better company since my sales guy was the best spokesperson for his employer any company could ask for. You know you have found something great when the product is fabulous but the guy at the store is invested in his product and employer! Well done and I am embarrassed I do do not remember great guy’s name.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: This is my new favorite coat. The way the waist can cinch up is very flattering and the collar is very cute too. The Elbow pads are in just the right spot to keep the fleece in good condition. I would definitely buy this again.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I wish they would have more colorful fall color choices but I went with the cream one. It’s very comfy and warm. It’s my preferred jacket because it keeps me warm during the snow time here.
review.name: Very warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: Heavyweight. Runs a smidge big. So comfortable and looks so nice!!! LOVE!!!
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: I have barely taken this fleece off since I bought it. It’s incredibly comfortable, warm and practical with zippy pockets and reinforced shoulders and elbows. Worth every penny. Absolutely adore it.
review.name: Like a big hug

name: Bacano Fleece Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought the cherry Beckman, then bought the black ones, both about 12 years ago.  I bought them because I wanted quality hand crafted footwear made in America. The boots only get better with age. I’m so impressed with the quality and workmanship of the Red Wing product.  I highly recommend adding this boot to your wardrobe, and ideally 2 pair.  The longevity and utility of this boot easily justifies the price in my opinion.
review.name: Owned these boots 12 years.  Still awesome

review.reviewBody: I wanted something more dressy than my Iron Rangers, with a lower toe profile. These boots hit the mark. The black cherry looks great and, in my opinion, better in person than in the pictures on the site. I've gotten quite a few compliments. Very versatile color.  I ordered true to size (1/2 size larger than my Iron Rangers) and they seem to fit well. I'm not having issues (mentioned in other reviews) with the speed hooks damaging the tongue. There are some light scuffs on the tongue that are to be expected, but not causing excessive damage or wear. The back of my speed hooks feel relatively smooth to the touch. I like Red Wing heritage boots, but I'm not against purchasing another brand. I looked at other similarly designed options from other brands, but did not find another USA Made boot of this quality at this price point.
review.name: Great Boots, Lower profile toe than IR

review.reviewBody: I bought the first pair in August, after a little break in period they were very comfortable, and I got a lot of compliments on them.  So I went and bought the Black and Cigar as well.  The tongue on the Cigar and Black Cherry shows some light scuffing from the speed hooks, but that is to be expected.  The Black pair shows none, probably because the leather is color correct all the way through.  Word the the wise, the Black pair was significantly harder to break in, and the Cigar was the easiest.  It look about 3 times as long to break in the Black pair vs. the Cigar, and still significantly longer than the Black Cherry.
review.name: Love them so much, I bought all 3 colors

review.reviewBody: Backcountry is the only site where I could find any kind of discount on Red Wings.  These are exactly what my son-in-law wanted.  He is over the moon with them.
review.name: My son-in-law loves!

review.reviewBody: I have had them for 2 months, I don't want to mess them up because I like them so much so I only wear them maybe once a week whenever I'm dressing up and don't have to work
review.name: Classic and elegant styling, quality product

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these boots following a recent purchase of Iron Rangers, and in response to all hype following Beckman re-release in September of 2024. These are definitely more refined, although I would not call them dressy by any means. Cherry Excalibur leather reminds me Horween color#8 in appearance and feel. I plan on wearing these with slimmer fitting jeans in casual and business casual settings. 
Sizing had me worried a bit, as I had no experience with RW 224 last. However, I was lucky to have been able to try on a pair of Beckman in size 9D (1/2 size down from my Brannock size 9.5D) at a local RW store, which I found to be a tad bit roomy with noticeable heel slip.. it wasn’t uncomfortable to where I couldn’t see myself wearing them, however, I own enough boots at this point in different brands to know to not settle for good enough, especially when considering the price tag that goes with them. 
In Iron Rangers I wear 8.5D which is a full size down from my Brannock size, which I credit to having lower volume, narrower feet. I ended up ordering 8.5D from Backcountry and they provide me the “comfortable snug” feel. Looking forward to breaking these in and enjoying them for many years to come!
review.name: Very nice heritage boot

name: Beckman Boot - Men's

My feet are fine ONLY with thinner socks. My feet are fine on 2+ hour rides in 60+ weather. I did a few shorter rides in 45-60* and my feet started to get cold after 1 hour (ish). That said, these low tops and I don't plan on using them in winter.
review.name: good shoe from my trusted brand

review.reviewBody: I always wear a size L in gloves.  I can’t get my hand into a size L with this glove, not even close.  Returning these, not sure it’s worth ordering the XL since the sizing was so far off.
review.name: Waaaay too small

review.reviewBody: Got these of my husband for a gift- He loved them but they started to tear first time wearing. OR has fantastic customer service and replaced the gloves promptly. Hopefully the other pair was a fluke and the new ones will be sturdier
review.name: Very warm gloves

review.reviewBody: First pair has to be replaced due to switch malfunction. But customer service came through! And the gloves are great- soft leather, warm, well designed
review.name: Great Glove

review.reviewBody: I ordered these late in the season and have only used them on one spring skiing day. I did not use the heaters but the gloves are well manufactured and I anticipate will work great next season. I would make one recommendation: like a lot of gloves, they are almost impossible to put on if your bare hands are moist. You will need a pair of thin glove liners to help you slip in to them.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: very warm but a bit bulky. I sized up based on feedback from a friend who has very large hands and I think I should have gone with what was actually my size. Other than that, they are very warm with the heater and work well on cold days.
review.name: Super Warm for Coldest Days

review.reviewBody: So many other brands have failed to meet the standards that the Prevail has set. I am amazed at the functionality of this glove, I had had so many past failures, that I had set the bar very low. I can only state this is the first time I have slied all day and still had left-over battery charge. This maybe the best glove on the market, for me it has made the difference between enjoying the day skiing, and having to end the day early due to painfully cold fingers.
review.name: Tried so many others, and this GLOVE Keeps my Hand warm,

review.reviewBody: I've used these 5 or 6 times skiing in the Canadian Rockies. The low and medium settings do a good job of preventing my hands from getting cold, while the highest setting is great for a quick blast to warm up while sat on a chairlift. I've only had one day so far when they ran out of power, on a very cold day where I skied 9-4 swapping between high and medium temperature settings. Considering the size of the batteries, I would've expected the gloves to feel bulkier than they are. They aren't noticeable at all when the gloves are on, they feel very comfortable. My only issue with the gloves is that they don't seem like they will last as long as they should for the price. I got the cream colored design because I liked the look of them - they look great but I would suggest getting black instead. After only a few days' use, most of the coloring on the palms has rubbed off so they look way more worn than they should. Also, some threads near the battery pouch are starting to come loose.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: Well made, very warm, functional heated ski gloves... I am beyond happy with this purchase. I have freezing cold hands on the slopes. These are exactly what I needed. Good price too.
review.name: So far...warm and toasty!

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Outdoor Research Heated Gloves because a friend that I ski with wears them every ski day and has had very good results. I ordered a pair in the XL size as that is the largest size offered. There is no reference as to what glove size this relates to. When the gloves arrived the label in the glove shows Xl and under that 10. I need a glove size 12 or 13. I'm very disappointed they do not fit as they appear to be very well made, and I was looking forward to keeping my hands warm. I tried much more expensive heated gloves that the on / off switch fails. Please make these gloves in a XXL size 12 or 13.
review.name: Sizing of the OR Prevail Heated Gore-Tex

name: Prevail Heated GORE-TEX Glove

review.reviewBody: I love these gloves! They fit perfectly, and the insides are very soft. I can't imagine how warm my hands are going to be on the mountain. To my surprise, the gloves come with a strap to put around your wrists and it come with oil and instructions to help keep the gloves nice!
review.name: In Love

review.reviewBody: After trying the unisex Fall Line in two sizes and then the Vortex for women, a size seven in these fit my larger hands. I simply tried the unisex out of convenience, but there really is a fit difference between the women’s Fall Line and men’a Fall Line. The leather is hearty and supple. The lining inside provides the coziest feel as my hand feels warm and cradled within it. The Velcro for the wrist enclosure feels super secure, more secure when you order a size down. These are beautiful and I can’t wait to use them for many years. I ordered the white to match my ski gear and it’s a super crisp clean white unlike the more vanilla tan white of the mens Fall Line.
review.name: Just Right

name: Fall Line Mitt - Women's

review.reviewBody: Other reviewer is absolutely correct that the sizing of this jacket is american sizing and not euro sizing.   Normally in Castelli,  I am a medium in tops.    Based on the other reviewer I ordered one size smaller,  a small.    Fit perfectly.   This is a cozy soft little jacket great for before and after cycling.   Since it has wool in it is surprisingly warm,  and warmer than those jackets that are just fleece.   It is not thin and it is not thick, but in the middle.    WHile I am petite,  I have a long torso and am 33c.   The extra small would have been too small for me.  Just order one size down from your normal castelli size.
review.name: Nice Jacket for before and after cycling

review.reviewBody: I really love this hoodie but note that it is NOT euro sizing. I had to order three times to get the correct size, which ended up being an XS.  I have washed it and air dried it with no shrinking.
review.name: Super comfortable

name: Milano Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's

Wouldn't mind if Columbia launched occasional "limited edition" with crazy colors.
review.name: Excellent quality, durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been wearing these pants as zip-off shorts for 6-7 years now. Mostly as shorts, but are great when you need to zip on the legs. I have seven pairs.

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Definitely another great La Sportiva shoe for my narrow, low volume foot. Has some heel slip where the Helios doesn’t. If you’re not use to Sportiva definitely size up. I wear a 12 in Adidas and wear a 46 in La Sportiva. Could possibly go 46.5 but I like a snug fit. Hope that helps.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I haven't done a full hike in them yet but I ordered a half size up and I'm not sure they'll work for me. I will wear them in a bit since my toe isn't hitting the front but they're very narrow so we'll see how it goes. Will update my review if they do well on the trail.
review.name: Run a FULL size small, not a half size

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes to hike the Camino de Santiago. I hiked all the way across Spain from France to the west coast, almost 900km across a variety of terrain, and these shoes were awesome. No blisters, held their structural integrity well, no toe problems. They are pretty well worn with almost no tread left but they exceeded my expectations.
review.name: Great shoes! 900km in 30 days!

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The shoes are very stylish and curvy... But..  Although I ordered one size larger, At least it was much smaller ( I wear 40.5, and buy 41.5) The sides are quite tight, which makes it impossible to move. Pay attention to the correct size selection. 

I only wore it once and it was so impossible to move I had to buy new shoes at the nearest store :D
review.name: Be careful when choosing the size

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Waaay too narrow in the toebox.  In all fairness, I was warned.  But I thought I might be able to stretch em out - not a chance.  I think they were compressing my tarsal bones so much it felt like an impending injury.  The construction looks La Sportiva great though.  I have a son with skinny feet - hope he can squeeze in.
review.name: Trail runners

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great grippy shoe but runs WAY too small.  I wear an 11 1/2 mens US size.  On the flawed size chart it says this corresponds to 45 EU size so that’s what I ordered.  Way too small so I exchanged it for a 46.  Still too small so exchanged for a 47 which fits well.  
The chart says this is a size 13 US.  Nonsense.
After all of the sizing complaints in these reviews, why don’t you correct your sizing chart?!
review.name: Runs 1 1/2 US sizes small!

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've owned several pairs of Busido II's and love them. They are the perfect combination of lightweight and breathable while offering good support and underfoot rock protection. Soles are grippy on rock as well as loose stuff. BUT I have a low-volume, long foot and doubt a more full-footed person will be as pleased. My foot measures a 11.75-12 B.
review.name: So great if they fit your foot

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ordered these in 8.5 as that’s my typical size. 8.5 was very small, 9’s are still small but after a few weeks of running in them they have stretched nicely. I have to say the back country returns were great and I couldn’t be happier with my customer service experience.
review.name: Great shoe for trail running

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband is a ultra trail runner and these are the only shoes he wears. We were delighted to find them at such a good price on this site.
review.name: Great Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shoe is long enough but very narrow and also tight fitting in the toe box. I sent them back.
review.name: Narrow

name: Bushido II Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I walk my dog 3-5 miles a day. I have always worn the Hoka Bondi for stability because of a bad ankle and plantar fasciitis. But the bottoms of the Bondi are pretty flat and wear out quickly on the road. This shoe is not quite a cushy but almost. It has great support and a better bottom for my trail and road walks. I'm still wearing the Bondi for the gym though. Can't beat the stability and cushioning of the Bondi.
review.name: Fabulous for road and trail

review.reviewBody: They are comfortable, but I think I will stick to the bondi line!
review.name: Wish they were more plush

review.reviewBody: As supportive and comfortable as my bondi 8 but less bulky looking
review.name: Very pretty (lavender shades)

review.reviewBody: These shoes are incredibly comfortable and provide lots of cushioning. I love the colors too! My only complaint is that the heel is a little too wide for me so there is some slipping.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing Arahi's for the past 6 years. My podiatrist had recommend them. I love them but the inside back always breaks down quickly and I did not love the new colors so I thought I would try something new. After a lot of research I settled on the Stinson 7. I wanted to try the H frame. I have been wearing them for 2 weeks. Love them! They come in great colors, comfortable, supportive and my feet feel great at the end of the day. Love the Stinson 7.
review.name: Game Changer

review.reviewBody: I absolutely LOVE the Stinson 7. I have several colors because they are the most comfortable and supportive shoe I have ever worn... right out of the box. Nice open toe box for those of us with bunions. No pressure points anywhere with this shoe. Please add more brighter colors!
review.name: Most Supportive Shoe Ever

review.reviewBody: I have flat feet so I over pronate. Recently developed left medial knee pain. These shoes have helped tremendously and knee pain has resolved. Thank you.
review.name: Comfortable shoe

review.reviewBody: I have problems with my feet - an artificial great toe joint in one foot and arthritis in the other great toe. This show has the wider toe box so I am not forcing my feet into a narrow shoe. I don't need a wide shoe overall, I actually have narrow feet but the joint issues mean I need that boxy area in the front. I like the stabilty. The only negatives for me are that it isn't as plush as I expected based on the description. That isn't a deal breaker, as I need to put in inserts that work around my joint. However, I'm surprised that this is rated as plush. I don't love the patterns but to have shoes that are comfy is well worth it. I'm not sure what it is best for - I am not allowed to run, jump rope, etc. because of the joint problems. However, it is great for walking - I can walk normally and not cause my arthtic joint to become inflamed and painful.
review.name: Love this shoe!

review.reviewBody: iI love this brand, i just can't get enough or say enough about these shoes
review.name: HOKA today, tomorrow all day everyday

review.reviewBody: Love these!!! Wish there was more bright color shoes like there used to be!!!
review.name: I have bought three other Hoka's

review.reviewBody:
Quality is ok, but it think the price tag is mostly based on their unusual design. They're look lovely though. 

My irk is that I usually wear 4, ordered 4.5, but these shoes feel like a 3.5. Although not painful when putting them on, I can see this going sotuh really fast after a couple hours of wearing them. They are tight, putting pressure of all areas of the foot.

The rubber of the sole digs into the curvature of the foot. It feels like the sole has been molded after someone's narrow feet, and you should order at least one size up to have a snug fit. My foot is 22 cm long, and 4.5 should've left substantial room. 

I will have to return these. I'll think about ordering a 5.5 in due course, since it'll likely take a while for return, refund, then again delivery.
review.name: Ok

review.reviewBody:
Great shoe comfortable  easy to put on
I bought a 1/2 Size larger because my sock are thicker perfect shoe. I’d purchase another
review.name: Wonderful shoe

review.reviewBody: Disappointed in how quickly one of the ribbons/elastics on the back of the shoe broke, just after a few wears. I love Sorel and this is the first I've ever been disappointed with a purchase.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Hello, MGT, We’re sorry that one of the ribbons/elastics on the back of the shoe broke. Please contact our support at (888) My-Sorel or web chat so we can make this right.

review.reviewBody:
Bought these few days ago in Black and I just love them to bits funky and so comfortable- these are my second pair of Sorel and the comfort is astonishing = me delighted 
Congratulations Sorel on your wonderful designs
review.name: Love Sorel Shoes - Black pair

review.reviewBody: I just got these 2 weeks ago and they are really comfortable, im a size 5 uk, they are a perfect fit for me. I liked the style of them when saw on line, but even more now when i put them on, love them, delivery was a little longer than i thought would be but only a few more days
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. Runs small, normally wear a size 6. Bought 6.5
review.name: Must buy

review.reviewBody: I can say these shoes are the most amazing shoes !!  I originally wanted to try these for leisure and an upcoming trip that I'll be doing alot of walking.  I decided to wear them for working out (boxing and kickboxing fitness class).  I found these shoes to be extremely supportive during the workout and also when I needed to do burpees and sprawls!!  I plan on buying a second pair for my upcoming trip and using current pair for the gym!!
review.name: Incredible shoes!!!!

review.reviewBody: This is the third bike I bought from Competitive. The first was an Ibis Ripley...which was very nice and very fast, but I couldn't keep it quiet...there were always creaks and pops from the bushings. I prefer the bearing system PIVOT uses, even if they weigh more than bushings. My second bike was the Version 2 Trail 429. I liked it so much, after a couple of years and a few thousand miles I bought the newest iteration! I've ridden several other bikes in the meantime (when I travelled and rented bikes a the destination), and something is "just right" about the Trail 429. I'm at the upper measurements for the medium size, but the medium feels just right to me with a 30 mm rise handlebar. I was curious how the vertically-mounted shock would work compared to the horizontal shock on my earlier version, and am happy to report the vertical-mount climbs at least as well...and it seems to react quicker to harder hits. I was quick to put protective film over the paint on much of the bike, something I didn't do on my old PIVOT. This should help keep the rock-strikes and inevitable wear and tear rubs at bay. The Dissector tires were new to me (I tended to run Recon and Ardent), and these have more bite...which is nice. Kevin at Competitive has set me up with a shorter crankset, since I prefer 170's to the 175's that come on a medium. Now that I've ridden a few hundred miles on the 175's, it will be nice to see if I get fewer pedal-strikes on the 170's...if not, I may "flip the chip" to raise the bottom bracket a bit, and give that a go. I'm very happy with the new shock performance and little tweaks to deal with mud/debris from the back tire on this new design. Of course, I can't tell there are 300 fewer grams of weight on this frame, but it surely doesn't hurt to have a strong AND lighter frameset. Wheels are the same, and I expect they'll give me thousands of mile of trouble-free service, just like my old ones did. I'm very happy with the new changes and after-delivery service from Kevin. THANKS!
review.name: PIVOT Trail 429...AGAIN!

review.reviewBody:
The Pivot Trail 429 is everything you could want in a trail bike. It is nimble and responsive where you need it going uphill and let's loose with great travel on the downhill. The front fork angle hits it just right for tackling big (and small) obstacles, corners extremely well, and the seat angle is perfect for everything on the trail. Although it doesn't quite handle big drops as well as my Evil The Following, the difference is only marginal. The front Fox 34 fork is quite fantastic. I agree with other reviews that the rear suspension feels appropriately sturdy in the locked position, doesn't bottom out in the open position, and has a very comfortable middle option. 

It is an aggressive bike that feels comfortable with either a casual ride or tackling black trails here in Colorado. It's also designed well to place 1-2 water bottles or other small bags. 

I haven't used the flip chip yet, so not sure how much that would change the handling. Backcountry did an awesome job with the build and components. Other than the slightly expensive price tag, I really don't have any complaints!
review.name: Awesome Well-Designed Trail Bike

name: Trail 429 Pro XT/XTR Mountain Bike

review.reviewBody: My new favorite hat. I have a BIG head and the L/XL fits perfectly!
review.name: Best fitting hat!

review.reviewBody:
Fjällräven needs an in-between Hat Size: Medium/Large!

Remember Fjällräven is a European Scandinavian brand and their hats fit differently than American sizing. I exclusively wear size S/M Flex-fit caps/hats. This is a real nice lightweight trucker hat made out of Fjällräven‘s proprietary lightweight G-1000 material. Modern ball-cap construction with a cool retro logo. 

The problem is the Sizing! S/M (Small/Medium) fits like a typical XS/S (Extra Small/Small) hat, and is for petite size heads. The L/XL (Large/Extra Large) is true to size and runs slightly large. So if you’re in-between sizes as I am, this trucker hat will NOT fit properly even though it’s still adjustable, especially if you wear your hats backwards. This goes for ALL other Fjällräven’s caps/hats, Medium size needed. Hopefully Fjällräven will eventually make an in-between hat size M/L (Medium/Large). 

I’m a hat connoisseur and I expect my hats to fit perfectly and they need be snug enough so when the wind blows it’s not going to fly off, but you don’t want it super tight because then it will give you headaches. You want it to fit like a glove, I mean hat. If Fjällräven adds a needed in-between size then their hats will fit all head sizes, and only then it will get a 5-star rating.

So if you’re a true American S/M I suggest not purchasing any of Fjällräven’s hats because you will be disappointed with the fitment and then you will be returning them.
review.name: In-between Hat Size Medium/Large needed!

review.reviewBody: My Daughter got this cap for me for my Bday. She knows I love the brand and it was a great gift item. This company fits with what I believe in, sustainability thoughtful design and a love for the outdoors. I am willing to support and wear the brand on a cool hat like this one.
review.name: Love This Brand

name: Vardag Langtradarkeps

review.reviewBody: Great size, magnetic closing saved me several times from dropping chalk all over the place, pockets are specially useful  for competitions, as you can organize your phone, tape, and any extras you need in different (perfect size) pockets!
review.name: Great great great!

review.reviewBody: perfect size
review.name: Chalk Bucket

review.reviewBody: I love this chalk bag, so far it’s taken some minor abuse but has held up and is still in great shape, and I love the feature where you can roll the top up and clip it together, it just sits on the back of my bag until I use it and I never have to worry about it falling off or forgetting it at home, plus the zipper feature is nice, I don’t use it too often, since usually I have a backpack with me but if I didn’t, it’d definitely be one of my favorite or if not my favorite feature.
review.name: Very portable, yet decently sized bouldering chalk bag

review.reviewBody: The relaxed cut and simple solid color of the Sight Jersey is excellent. A comfortable, breathable, and lightweight jersey that can be used in many applications aside from cycling.
review.name: Simple perfection

review.reviewBody:
The perfect warm/hot weather cycling jersey for understated looks and performance. The slightly heathered material is light as a feather and soft as your favorite T shirt without feeling or looking techy.

The cut is t-shirt like in terms of roominess, and there's a small, unobtrusive key pocket on the left hip if you need it. 

You could absolutely wear this riding and then stop for a pint or two afterwards and not look like a motocross rider or like you're in your PJs like so many MTB kits. Understated performance.
review.name: Not sure how to top it

name: Sight Shirt Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: My picky teen daughter loves this jacket. The fit is perfect and she loves how it's warm but not bulky.
review.name: I would definitely buy this jacket again

review.reviewBody: Both of my daughters got these and they are warm and comfy. They are very happy wearing them.
review.name: I would definitely recommend these

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves her new jacket. It's lightweight but still keeps her very warm, even in freezing temperatures. We recently visited Colorado and snowshoed for over an hour and she never once complained about being cold. I highly recommend this jacket, especially for kids with sensory issues that don't tolerate wearing heavy jackets.
review.name: Very warm and cute jacket

review.reviewBody: Kids version price should be cheaper at least until size 16 because they grow fast and every year they need a new one Can't afford your prices Dose not mater of durability if you have to buy every year Yes me as an adult I have mine for 3 years and worth the money but not for kids
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: Love the fit and style of this coat. We had an older style that lasted 3+ years. This one is superior in warmth. My daughter is 5'5" and weighs approx 100 lbs. We got the XXL (18/20) and it's large enough she can grow into it, and it still looks great. For reference, I am 5'7", 145 lbs and I can wear this coat too.
review.name: 10/10 - Northface coats are worth every dollar!

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased for my granddaughter and she loves it. This coat is well worth the money. The coat arrived in a very short time and so easy to order. Highly recommend ordering from Northface.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: Great quality light weight but keeps you very warm
review.name: I would definitely recommend to my friends

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves her new coat! It's warm and fits great.
review.name: I would buy this coat again!

review.name: Overall worth the money

review.reviewBody: The material is perfect, the size is correct and the texture is good for the cold, it is perfect

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Don't believe the one-star reviews. This is a fantastic shoe. I have many GTX trail shoes in my 20-shoe rotation since I live and train year-round here in CO, and this one breathes better than any of them. I have a fairly typical foot and arch, so no shoe ever really bothers my feet much IF I have the correct size.  The cushion is good, the trail feel is top-notch, and the vibram megagrip is awesome.  It's one of my favorite shoes in my rotation now.
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very disappointed with the fit of this shoe specifically the shoe tongue. Very tight and impossible to put on. Had to return and will look at other models.
review.name: The 1 star reviews are true

name: Speedgoat 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I recently wore the Hoka Transport Sneakers on a 10-day trip to France, and they were the perfect choice! From navigating wet city streets to strolling through parks, museums, and monuments, these sneakers held up wonderfully. The waterproof feature was a lifesaver in unpredictable weather, keeping my feet dry and comfortable all day. The comfort level is unbeatable – I walked miles each day with no discomfort. Highly recommend these for anyone needing versatile, stylish, and reliable footwear for urban adventures.
review.name: Perfect Travel Companion

review.reviewBody: You guys were my favorite stop!! Until FedEx started your deliveries I never get what I order and I just stopped even considering placing one!!:(
review.name: Why FedEx
comment: We are very sorry to hear FedEx does not work well in your area.  We also use USPS for  deliveries, just call or chat in and we can help place the order and ensure it ships USPS for you!

review.reviewBody: These worked great for me as a nurse working long shifts. I really like the cute neutral color to match my scrub sets too! Also I don't have to worry about my shoes untying while I'm rushing around.
review.name: Nursing Shoes

review.reviewBody: I own 3 different colors in this style of shoes. I absolutely LOVE them. Everything about them from the shoe laces to the fit of the shoe. So comfortable.
review.name: I own 3 pairs

review.reviewBody: This would be my fifth pair of Hoka's but this model is very difficult to wear:(
review.name: I would buy a different model

review.reviewBody: Wish the rubber toe cap came up higher on shoe. Always get a hole over big toe. Suffered from plantar fasciitis for ten years. Started wearing Hokas 8 years ago- no more pain. This nurse recommends Hokas to everyone.
review.name: Love hokas!

review.reviewBody: Fit me perfectly, very comfortable, very good stability. I have 3 pair already.
review.name: Love my Hokas

review.reviewBody: I appreciate the style and comfort of these shoes. Because I do have a high instep and a need for more heel cushioning I switched out the insoles and now have the perfect fit for my walking needs. Since wearing them my back ache cleared up, my leg pain has all but disappeared and my arches are very supported. Happy feet! Happy Me!
review.name: Happy Feet!

review.reviewBody: I needed a pair of shoes for a trip to Switzerland that had to be water resistant, wide, for hiking, casual looking (not a hiking boot look) and a color to match every color. The eggnog transport fit all my criteria. I broke them in 1 week before an 11 day trip to Switzerland. These were the only shoes I wore. We hiked near the Matterhorn during rain and the grip was great. Walked on ice and slush at the Gornergrat and did not slip. Hiked 8 miles another day on very rocky terrain and my feet did not hurt. Love the no tie shoe laces. Easy to clean, used wet cloth. I plan to wear them for work and future vacations.
review.name: Stylish and comfortable

review.reviewBody: If you actually want that wide toe box -- these are not it. The Bondi's are so comfortable -- and actually wide, they fit my square feet :-) These are not that. The "wide" are quite narrow. Would love a waterproof trail shoe that fits like the bondi.
review.name: not WIDE

name: Transport Sneaker - Women's
Hoka Women's Transport Sneaker | GH Review

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cute pants but the buttons and the zippers are cheap. They do not hold.
review.name: nice but not good quality

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I only had a long weekend to try them out on the slopes since buying but love them so far. I like the color, warmth, fit, and pockets. Hopefully they’ll hold up well.
review.name: Good buy!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Returned because they are ridiculously long. I’m 5’5. Too bad not available in petite or short length
review.name: Too long

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these crossing my fingers they’d fit because I had a trip coming up and needed new pants that weren’t ugly boxy and super unflattering. These were such a pleasant surprise when I got them. Not only did they look and fit great but I put them to the test immediately wearing them in 17 degree weather and with a thin base layer underneath, I was warm and comfortable. Side note I can’t emphasize enough how wonderful and helpful Backcountry’s customer service is. For this fact I’ll be a customer for life!
review.name: Buy them!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered these in both a medium and large and needed the large. I am a true size medium per the measurement chart, and this is pretty consistent across brands. I have the matching coat and the medium fits GREAT. However, while the medium ski pants fit in the waist (slightly tight but not bad) they were *tight* across butt/upper thigh/hip. I am not pear-shaped (I'm 5'11" 155 lbs, kinda straight figure) but I strength train so have some bulk in the butt and quads, although given my height, I can't get thicker like some do (sigh)). Even though these have stretch, I could tell that when seated these would constrict and feel uncomfortable. The large is definitely big across the waist but cinch down okay, and they allow much more freedom of movement. You kinda need that for skiing! Hello! My kingdom for a pair of ski pants cut bigger in the butt/hips/thighs so you can actually move and not have to belt or cinch down. Reading reviews across many companies you see the same issue over and over. The only one to come close is Outdoor Research, IMO. As far as length for the tall ladies, mediums were slightly too short but would've been okay with boots. Larges fit better but also because they hang a bit lower due to the looser waist.
review.name: Size up if you have some muscle...

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved how cute they were and how warm they were on the slopes but after one fall my pants ripped below the knee. Not an area that experiences a lot of stretch so I was really sad my brand new ski pants aren’t in new condition anymore.
review.name: Pink is very cute and pretty warm!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Please see my video review. Better to show than tell!
https://youtu.be/Nur7EXDfnKQ
review.name: Poor Manufacturing

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've sold so many Last Chair pants to customers that love them that I decided to give them a try myself. I love so many of our outerwear pieces and these are definitely ones I can add to the list. They are super soft, stretchy, breathable and comfortable. They are very versatile by having medium-weight insulation that is perfect most days on the slopes. If you layer well underneath it, you can stay warm in very cold conditions, as well. The breathable fabric and thigh vents dump heat when working hard on the slopes or in warmer conditions. The 15K waterproofing kept me dry in a snowstorm when I wore them. These are on the long side for me at 5'4", so the bibs with adjustable length worked out better for me. Otherwise the fit was true to size with lots of adjustability with the velcro waist tab. I loved wearing these and recommend them.
review.name: Tried them, Loved them!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the first pair of nice ski pants I’ve bought. I wear for downhill skiing. They are insulated and I have been comfy in them on cold days as well as warm days! Very soft material and easy to move in. Would highly recommend. I am petite and 5 3’ and the small was great for my waist and length wise too.
review.name: So comfy!!!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these ski pants last year and wore them skiing for a month long ski stay in Breckenridge.  
They are so comfortable and the fit is perfect for my curvy athletic body.  All of the features with the insulation and the stretch would be found on a much more expensive pair of ski pants. I am a 14/16 in ladies pants and the xl fit me beautifully.  I am also 5'9" tall so the inseam is perfect!  Believe me when I say that I have ordered and returned over 15 different pairs of ski pants trying to find a pair that was both comfortable and flattering on my 54 year old body.  These are the ones!  I want to buy another pair just to have them in my rotation for fear you will stop making these, but I am disappointed in this years' colors.  I already have the light green sea foam from last year so would love a darker color (not black), but the colors from this year would make me look like a giant toddler.  How about some adult colors for the mature skier? :)
review.name: Love these pants! More colors please!

name: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Two-star totem review... hot take, I know.  The functionality of these cams is pretty nice (though honestly not any better than a standard BD/WC cam), however the black totem has a major design flaw in that the load bearing cables that wrap around the lobes protrude significantly when the cam is retracted for placement.  This causes abrasion of the load bearing cables against the rock and eventual failure of the cam via fraying cables.  Googling "black totem frayed wires" yields several forum users with similar stories.  Just looking at the cam while retracted, you can see how much the wires stick out compared to the larger pieces.  Surprised that totem engineers did not notice and/or care about this glaring issue. 
Totem will not warranty this, and it is not a part of the cam they can repair.  My black lasted 8 months of weekend use.  Overall, not worth the hype and extra price tag unless maybe you're seriously into hard aid.  After about a year of moderate use with a full rack, I won't be recommending or purchasing any more totems and will just stick with my other cams that cost less and have lasted years without issue.
review.name: Average cams, major design flaw

review.reviewBody:
I currently have a black, blue, and yellow totem in my kit.

They are my go-to for finger cracks and are handy for anchors.

Their engineers really created a modern marvel for trad-climbing, that makes thin stuff feel safe.
review.name: A must have for any crack climber

review.reviewBody: Going from camelots or friends to totems is like going from a flip phone to a new smartphone. You will not believe how much more versatile the totem is it seems it can be placed just about anywhere. These cams are also very light and flexible I just wish I could trade in all my other cams and get more totems. If your used to black diamond and wild country sizes it's super easy all the sizes match up except the yellow and 🍊 orange here's the deal stick a gray carabener on the yellow and rack it next to the 0.4 black diamond the orange one goes between the red and yellow black diamond it's like a 2.5 in black diamond sizes
review.name: How Is this possible

review.reviewBody:
Have a pretty varied rack when it comes to cams from different companies .. and the totem cams are just easier to place with confidence ! 

If you're just getting into trad climbing look no further ! When you go to place other cams you just wish they were all totems !
review.name: Totem Cams are Worth It !

review.reviewBody: Have a single rack of totems, and in comparison to my C4s, I much prefer placing a totem. Easy to place, narrower head width, and just feel much more satisfied with my placements. Versatile cam, and also fits perfectly for horizontal placements
review.name: Bomber and easy to place

review.reviewBody: The design of these cams is incredible. With the shape of the lobe allowing to act as an offset as well as a standard cam and replacement is perfect. My favorite cam is being DD?s Camelot there even more narrow making it easier to place in pins scars. You need nothing else but these and micro nuts. As nacho would say ?They are the best?
review.name: Never placed an easier Cam.

review.reviewBody: They're really that good. Just read literally any other review anywhere. You just feel good when you place one.
review.name: People get jealous

review.reviewBody:
These cams are the best. Why?

1. They fit where other cams don't
2. They are bomber. and i've tested that. more times than I care to admit.
3. They are perfect in the small sizes.  Everyone knows about the legendary Black totem.  It has legendary status for a reason.  Fits where other cams don't.
review.name: Money!

review.reviewBody: Totems go in and stay where a C4 or TCU simply won?t! Because the load is distributed and equalized from the lobes individually, you can place them in really wonky ways, almost like an offset (within reason). Perfect in pin scars, almost never walk, and load over corners like nothing else. Get totems.
review.name: Bomber Cams

name: Totem Cam
Totem Cams | GH Review

hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpine Folding Utensils - Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We were recently given this set from MSR to use and I love love love them. I like how they are all multipurpose which cuts down on the amount of items I need to remember to bring with us. I think we must use the cheese grater at every meal.
review.name: Great little set

review.reviewBody: These are so light & portable, I love the fact that each tool is multipurpose. The general design is genius but I do wish they looked nicer, the handles could be better. We'll see how they hold up in the long run. Happy with my purchase so far.
review.name: Great design, wish it looked nicer

review.reviewBody: Not stiff enough. Last version was much more effective.
review.name: Look for a stiffer spatula.

review.reviewBody: I had lost my original spoon on a trip this past spring and didn't think twice about replacing it with the same product. These utensils are lightweight and durable. I especially find the measuring marks on the spoon to be very useful when making stews while car camping.
review.name: Great durable utensils

review.reviewBody: I love that I can grate cheese then flip my omelette! Genius!
review.name: Smart

review.reviewBody: The listing above includes the ladle and cheese grater but my order was for the spatula only. Either way, it works well and providing one doesn't try to flip logs with it, the light weight should help justify having it on hand.
review.name: Only the spatula.

review.reviewBody: Works better than any other lightweight utensils I've tried.
review.name: Perfect ultralight utensil set

review.reviewBody: These are so handy to have and I love that they fold up. Who doesn't wish they had one of these when they need it?
review.name: Great utility tools

review.reviewBody: Was give as a Christmas gift for hiking, these are lite weight and fold up nicely. Great for turning eggs and pancakes.
review.name: Great lite weight utensils

review.reviewBody: good quality and lightweight for this mini set must have!
review.name: a must have!

name: Alpine Folding Utensils - Set

hasVariant.name: Nuuk Lite Parka - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Nuuk Lite Parka - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nuuk Lite Parka - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Nuuk Lite Parka - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Have had about a year and only have 2 gripes but they’re significant. I hate the velcro especially on the sleeves. Put a couple snaps there. The velcro takes too long to adjust especially with fleece or wool gloves. The other issue is the zipper is awful. Just awful. It’s difficult to manage under ideal circumstances and nearly impossible with gloves,

It is VERY comfortable and warm. I’m gonna stick with it but am gonna be making some modifications.
review.name: Almost great!

review.reviewBody: Everything about this jacket was good except the material felt very cheap and scratchy. Wish it had the G1000 material so bad. It would be the perfect jacket. I had the Singi for several years and loved it, but was looking for a lighter version of it. I was hoping they’d made the change for this season but looks like they didn’t.
review.name: Why not G1000??

review.reviewBody: I purchased this jacket to replace a Skogso. I wanted something that was waterproof and with a bit more cover. This jacket is fantastic. I live in the PNW and we have damp "cold" weather. (rarely below freezing.) so this jacket is better suited for here the the standard Nuuk Parka.
review.name: Perfect for the PNW

review.reviewBody: Been studying this jacket since last year and finally pulled the trigger. Granted its not had a cold test but as soon as you put it on you can tell its absolutely solid. The zipper.... it's not that difficult guys so please ignore the other comments. Every detail is super premium. Medium correct fit for a 5,7 giant of a man.
review.name: Hurry up and get cold

review.reviewBody:
After getting through a NYC December/January where conditions ranged from 40F with heavy rain to nearly 10F with strong wind and snow, I can officially say I love this jacket.  It’s very stylish and the warm adjustable hood is a highlight.  I prefer the flexibility of having a versatile “lighter” jacket that can get through three seasons but this jacket isn’t super light. When it got down into the 20s, I just layered with a light insulated vest and the jacket remained effective.

I don’t understand some of the complaints in other reviews… two-way zippers are always a little more difficult to zip up but with the longer length of the jacket, it’s well worth it.  And no, my arms didn’t get cold in the jacket either.
review.name: Great for NYC commuting!

review.reviewBody: Two way zipper (which no one wants) DOES NOT WORK
review.name: wrong zipper

review.reviewBody:
bought ten days ago...
light but enough warm, 
high quality, 
not too short not too long, 
true to size as an overcoat, 
large & functional pockets, 
overall highly practical parka
review.name: light & warm & practical

review.reviewBody: Currently returning it. I'm so so bummed. The quality is amazing, it feels warm, and it looks so good. Sigh, unfortunately, even the XS doesn't fit. How?! Small fits me everywhere, but I had a feeling it might not fit me at a small. I thought the small would be too big, but I would naver had thought that the Extra Small! would still not fit! Whats even crummier, that the shoulder fit was perfect, jackets never get that right. But the lengths were so long. Arms and bottom. Completely covered my hand, and bottom to my knees. Sigh. dang it.
review.name: Size bigger than standard sizes

name: Nuuk Lite Parka - Men's

review.reviewBody: I converted my 2x9 to a 1x11. Porter helped me return an incorrect part (my fault) and select this Wolf Tooth chainring. It bolted up seamlessly including my bash ring. No chain guide on my bike and after 2 rides it has been flawless!  Very happy with the product and customer support.

review.reviewBody:
This design is only for single ring setups. I read reviews that said they were running this chainring on a 2x10, but Wolf Tooth says specifically not to.  
I found that out after I ordered it, but never installed it to find out. 
That being said, the ring looks well made and the blue color is nice.

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've used this a number of times now.  Temps around 40 degrees.  Layers underneath.  No problems with cold or wind.
review.name: Stay warm.  Be seen.  High quality.

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Have used this for a month in cold weather 40-50 degress. It is a very solid product with excellent quality
review.name: Gore jacket

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good at stopping the wind.  Insulates well.  Only concern is the fit.  I normally wear a Large jacket, but I ordered an XL based on prior experiences with C5's.  I hoped this might be a little more generous in its sizing.
review.name: Infinium C3 Jacket

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered a US XL, came as an EU XXL, which is too big, but according to the size chart is supposed to be XL.  The size difference is huge, a US L is 42.5 a US XL is 43.5 but acutally is more like a US 45, I wear a US 43 so the XL which is actually a US XXL is too big and the size down according to the chart is too small!
review.name: Strange

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Ordered a mans extra large and it wouldnt fit across my shoulders. I am 5ft6, 170 pounds.
It was too small for my 118 pound 5ft 4 wife.
review.name: C3 gortex bike jacket

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this to use for rides when the temperature is in the 40s. What I found is that it is warmer than I expected because of the windstopper layer. I use it with a good base layer for rides in the 30s. I just came back from a ride where it was 31 and the base layer absorbed a bunch of sweat. Highly highly recommended. I find the US versus European sizing amusing, but I suspect that anyone who has bought garments from European manufactures knows this already. Another thing that makes this really warm. It has a tall warm collar.
review.name: My warmest jersey

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'6" and 135 Lbs wearing medium size. It's run a little bit large to my body, but it wasn't bad. Some reviews on the Gorewear website say products run small on thermal jersey, which is not on my case. But I'm happy because I didn't want it to fit in my skin. I have to wear a short or long base layer every time. 
Fabric is soft and comfortable. It's so easy to wear. I have been using it for a couple of times this fall already. Chicago weather  around 60 F° and chill windy day. With a short base layer, it's way too warm for me, but in 55 F°, it was perfect. 40 miles round trip both times. Very comfortable. Temperature above 45 F° with a long base layer and a good wind jacket should be just fine for me.
review.name: Great purchase

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had been looking for a wind/rain-proof outer layer for rides down to freezing level. Just got this and man, exactly what I was after. Entirely negates wind chill. Tried it out on a 45-degree day with a t-shirt and long-sleeve polyester shirt over that as base layers. Ended up taking off the long-sleeve I was so toasty. Key thing: Read earlier reviews to size up. I'm 5'10", 150 lbs, normally wear a men's small in almost everything for a fitted but not tight look. In this case ordered the US medium and it's just right. Enough room for layers underneath, but not loose, still looks fitted. Style also good, looks performance without being flashy. Highly recommended.
review.name: Game changer

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wear a medium for all shirts including athletic wear (running, riding). I originally ordered a medium but could barely even put it on. I sent it back and got the large. I just finished my first ride with it. The large-size is perfect, kept me very warm on a 30 mile road bike ride in 40 degree temps with light rain. I wore this jacket and an underarmour baselayer (cold gear). That was plenty to keep me warm on my upper body at this temp. My feeling is it would be fine down into the 30s but not much colder than that.
review.name: Great jacket - runs small

name: C3 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: Dzero DUB XX1 Power Meter Spider
hasVariant.description: Buy the Quarq Dzero DUB XX1 Power Meter Spider online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Dzero DUB XX1 Power Meter Spider
review.reviewBody: I have used Quarq power meters for many years on all my road bikes. This one works exactly as expected on my mountain bike. The one useful thing I can add is a gram weight. The total weight for 170mm XX1 DUB cranks, spindle, 32-tooth ring, and this PM spider was 545 grams. For comparison, my 170mm SX Eagle DUB cranks, spindle, and ring were 786 grams, about an 8.5 oz. (over half a pound) difference.
review.name: 545 Grams with 170mm XX1 DUB Cranks

review.itemreviewed: Dzero DUB XX1 Power Meter Spider
review.reviewBody:
There's not much to say about it. It works great, and I haven't had any issues with it after ~150 hours on it.

I ended up having to order different chain ring bolts than on my stock bike through my LBS to attach these to new chainrings. No big deal, just a heads up - wasn't super straightforward to figure out which bolts.
review.name: Works great

name: Dzero DUB XX1 Power Meter Spider

review.reviewBody:
I own several pairs of Castelli shorts, and all of them are pretty expensive. I have to say, I love the Castelli fit and chamois padding, but there are some differences between this model and the next more advanced one. (I also have the Premio Model)

On these, the chamois interior foam and padding takes a lot longer to dry compared to the Premio. Thankfully, both are comparably comfortable.

I also find that the shoulder flat bib straps tend to bunch up initially when putting these on, versus the Premio straps that have a built in small red spreader patch that keeps this from happening.

All in all these are super comfortable on longer rides, though they seem tight or small at first. I live in the US, am 6' tall and weigh around 185lbs, and the XL size of the Premio is small but more supportive, and 2XL sizes of the Superleggera fits me as well, but without as much compression.
review.name: Comparing My Castelli Bike Shorts

review.reviewBody: It runs very small it is light weight and comfortable specially the rib.
review.name: Great material

review.reviewBody:
These do match the description from Castelli. The bibs are thin and light and are great for rides on really hot days. But being so light and thin, they do not seem like they would be supportive on longer rides. For my 35 to 45 mile rides they were fine, but I don't know if I would use these on a century. 

Out of the box, the material felt rather stiff with an almost crunchy feel. The interior area around legs had a rough texture which was a concern. But once on bike they were fine. The length is bit longer than usual. I'm 5'11" and on me they end pretty close to the top of the knees. Consequently, the leg openings looks like they should be tighter. I've only worn them a few times and the leg opening are developing an ever so slight ruffle around the edge. But somehow they don't manage to ride up when I'm pedaling. The straps are flat and are much easier to deal with than the Castelli Free Aero Race 4's, which are like ropes until you straighten them out. Sizing was typical for Castelli in that they run slightly small. The Progetto X2 Air Is one of the best out there.

I took one star off because the leg length should shorter, or given the length, the opening should be tighter.  If they stretch out over time, the leg grippers will not be able to hold them in place.
review.name: Odd material but working out so far.

name: Superleggera Bib Short - Men's
Superleggera Bib Short - Men's

hasVariant.name: Index S2 Smart Scale
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Index S2 Smart Scale online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Index S2 Smart Scale
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Index S2 Smart Scale online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This makes it brain dead to track your progress and short comings
review.name: Great tracking

review.reviewBody: Overall the scale is awesome. I like that it detects the multiple users based on weight. It’s easy to track my data because it connects to the app. The only thing that could improve is that it takes a few seconds to turn on when I want to weigh myself.
review.name: Great data

review.reviewBody: I've had the scale for about a month.  It's about 60% more expensive than the other scale we have which provides the same measurements.  It does sync with the Garmin Connect app, which the other scale doesn't do.  That's about all I can say, it does the job but you have to decide if the sync feature is worth it to you.
review.name: Expensive compared to similar scales out there.

review.reviewBody:
There are multiple features I love such as the synch with the app without the need to open the app first or even have the phone nearby when the weight is recorded. The auto tare is convenient. I can think of no features that are missing from this scale that my twoother scales had.
The only shortfalls are that it doesn't always wake when stepeed on and must be moved slightly (not a huge shortfall) and that the bofy fat percentage can be miles off the mark!! I care more about body fat percentage and muscle mass than BMI and the scale was off by about 11%, which is huge. The app feature to calibrate it is not easy and took several attempts to get to a close to accurate reading.
Now that the body fat is close to accurate, I'm VERY pleased with my recent birthday gift.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: I purchased a scale, not expecting it to do everything. The manufacturer says it would do, but it did. I’m very happy with the scale.
review.name: Index. S2 smart scale.

review.reviewBody: The scale won't connect to internet. When troubleshooting,  I discovered on Garmin site the model won't connect to 2.4hz, which is what I have, so now I can't use all of the scales features.
review.name: Won't connect to internet

review.reviewBody: Easy to use. I love the display and how it shows everything.
review.name: Scale

review.reviewBody: I bought this white scale two weeks ago. I'm pleased with all the features it has. My wife and I are going to do a little contest at the beginning of the year. This should help a lot with tracking weight and muscle.
review.name: Love this scale

review.reviewBody: Very convenient and easy to use if you are in the garmin ecosystem. Kinda a bummer that it doesn’t sync to zwift like other smart scales. The body composition data was wildly inaccurate. Got a professional body composition analysis and used that to “set body composition” and now it seems to track pretty accurately.
review.name: Good, but needs calibration.

review.reviewBody: I used a Garmin scale for many years, but it died.  I purchased a Withings and got similar readings to my old Garmin.  I just bought a new S2 for my 2nd home.  All the readings track, but the Body Fat % is double what my other scale shows.  I researched and this seems to be an issue for older users (I'm 64).
review.name: Works well, but Body Fat% is off

name: Index S2 Smart Scale

review.reviewBody: Used my new Leki trekking poles to climb Mount Chocorua. Leki keeps reusing their one piece collapsible design. Sturdy fasteners allow the length to be adjusted from 110-130cm. These poles now have an extended grip for those moments you quickly need a shorten pole.  The best improvement from my prior pair is that the bottom of the grips have been rounded over, no sharp edge. Get out and hike! #leki #lekipoles
review.name: Great Trekking Poles!

review.reviewBody: These are the best Trekking poles, they are a must for me.
review.name: Life Savers

review.reviewBody: Love these trekking poles. Very light weight, and extremely sturdy and durable. I love the design as they are easily stored in a backpack if I don't need them. Highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome Trekking Poles!

review.reviewBody: These are some of the best on the market today, the other best ones are leki as well

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Pull-On Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I usually love Oboz shoes, and have had many pairs over the years. I really wanted these boots to work, but the pull tab ripped out of the left boot as I pulled them on for the first time. The fit over the top of my foot was very tight, so I changed my socks to a very thin pair- still too tight! They look nice, and feel warm and grippy, but the fit was too constricted. So bummed to have to send these boots back, and also sad that I have to pay Backcountry to ship them back (somehow missed that part of the return policy).
review.name: Strange fit, pull tab broke out of box

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Pull-On Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have two other pair of Oboz boots that I love and fit well.  I read multiple reviews that said these boots run small and that you should order a half size up. I have a narrow Foot and normally wear a size 8, so I ordered an 8 1/2. I couldn’t even get my feet into the boots. I was disappointed because they appear to be well-made and are very stylish.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Pull-On Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I wear a 6.5 narrow and based on reviews, ordered a size 7. I had difficultly getting my foot into the shoe and then it was extremely tight once in. 

Also, the pinedale is an olive green color. I thought it was a shade of grey based on the website’s photos.
review.name: Too small and color not as pictured

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Pull-On Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was so sad these didn’t work- they looked great. Not for high volume feet- too tight all through mid foot- even when sizing up a half size. Disappointed.
review.name: Great boot- but only for low volume feet

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Pull-On Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are high quality and very comfortable! Not only are they cute, but also warm. They are my go-to boots in the winter. I love that I can slip them right on and be out the door. The arctic grip on the rubber really works too - it gives me great traction! I would highly recommend if you are looking for a casual and warm winter boot.
review.name: Comfortable, warm, and CUTE!

review.itemreviewed: Sphinx Pull-On Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I fell in love with these boots when I opened the box:  high quality and cute ?  Until I tried to put them on!  I pulled and pushed and finally got my foot into them, but they were SO TIGHT across the top of my foot i had to return them.  Oboz- PLEASE make room for those with high arches!  I?m so sad that I cant wear these.  Length and width are just right, so I copuldn?t change sizes.
review.name: High Quality.  Not made for high instep

name: Sphinx Pull-On Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
