hasVariant.description: Buy the BOTE Adjustable Kayak Paddle 5-Piece online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can't wait to have a few ice cold beers in my new Bote. Amen
review.name: Beers and Bote

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Personally don't use it, find it easier to paddle with a standard canoe paddle.
review.name: Personally don't use it, find

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I finally got a chance to take this out on a local lake. It was awesome. I am not a good balancer or swimmer so have been worried about how I would feel floating around. It was amazing, I could have stayed out on the lake all day. I also love that I can practice standing as if it were a paddle board. The kayak itself feels sturdy and dependable. It is a bit heavier than I thought it would be, but nothing compared to my husbands sit upon kayak.
review.name: Comfortable & Sturdy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We love Bite products! We have most pool/accessories but this was our first kayak purchase. We got it to be able to take our 3 year old who had a stroke and suffers from CP as a result out on the water. He loves it and so do we! It's easy to inflate and just as easy to collapse and put away! I wish I could attach a pic to this review :)
review.name: We love BOTE!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is a excellent build quality. My family enjoying using the board.
review.name: Excellent build quality.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This paddle is well made. I am 6’2” and sometimes have to choke up on rental paddles with hard shell kayaks especially. I like the ease and comfort that this paddle provides as well as the convenience of being able to change its length to accommodate my paddling activity. Sometimes it’s nice to free-style and other times it’s nice to have them attached like a stern-frame. AGAIN, every aspect is customized for ease of use and performance. And they are dummy-proof (you can only assemble them in their correct way…very German or Swiss).
review.name: GREAT PADDLE for ALL levels of Inflatable Boating

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It does the job and breaks down pretty small compared to normal paddles. It definitely is not super light though just average weight.
review.name: Does the job and compact

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Kayak paddles easily adjusts and love the rubber on the paddles. Best paddles I have used
review.name: Great kayaking paddles

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Bote Zeppelin is a sturdy, well made, and fun kayak. I’m looking forward to using it a lot next summer!
review.name: Love the Zeppelin

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wish I bought it earlier in the season. Very sturdy and very comfortable.
review.name: Highly recommend

name: Adjustable Kayak Paddle 5-Piece

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Double Haul Convertible Duffel 30L Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Double Haul Convertible Duffel 30L Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Double Haul Convertible Duffel 30L Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This bag wasn't very impressive when it arrived.  It seemed so small, but when opened and unzipped it kept getting larger and larger.  With all of the ways to carry, like a backpack, with a shoulder strap, or with handles it is very configurable.
review.name: this takes all

review.reviewBody: Working in an outdoor store offers many opportunities to examine multiple bags. We carry models of most popular brands, but not this NEMO bag. We brought it in to compare it to the competitors models and there are many reasons why it is superior. The functionality, the expandable size, the lightweight material which appears durable but not overly stiff, the quality of the zipper and straps. I have asked my supervisor to have our reps look into this bag. Personally we are looking forward to real world testing during camping trips and carry-on flights. Great job NEMO for offering quality and value.
review.name: An Early Opinion

review.reviewBody: I have been using the Nemo 30L duffle bag for several months now, and I couldn't be happier with my choice! I was initially torn between the 30L and 50L sizes, but the 30L has proven to be more than enough space for a four-day trip as well as staple for everyday use. The construction is top-notch, with durable materials that hold up beautifully under various conditions. It’s incredibly versatile, easily accommodating all my essentials for travel or daily outings. Whether I’m heading to a weekend getaway or just running errands, this bag has exceeded my expectations. Highly recommend!
review.name: Absolute best bag!

review.reviewBody: Every time I use my 30L double Haul, I find a new feature for a new need. Starting with the tote style, you can throw anything in, and the space seems never ending. You can zip away everything, so nothing falls out in transit. This is my new everything bag. I use it on the weekends for overnight stays, I've used it as a carry on and personal item (it does fit under the seat comfortably, and I am 6'2) Throwing more expensive gear in the car in it, taken it on the beach, and always lives through every adventure. The tote straps are very durable, and I love the snaps on them to hold them together on your shoulder. The two inner and outer zip pockets are perfect for small items like keys and wallet. My favorite part is the durable, water resistant material on the outside. I've gotten it wet and set it down in mud and everything inside stays dry. I will definitely be getting a bigger size to easily throw all of my camping gear into.
review.name: Features are well thought out

review.reviewBody: I bought the 30L convertible. It has become my go-to back for any kind of excursion. Easily packed it inside my larger luggage on a trip to Brazil and used it for 2 and 3 day trips while there. Even use it for my carry-on for business trips as I love the versatility and size. The quality and attention to detail are obvious. Love it so much have since bought the 55L and 100L to round out my collection.
review.name: Love this duffel

review.reviewBody:
Gear junkie who's recently discovered the versatility of a duffle over a backpack. Originally bought the 30L. Which is perfect as a carry on for small trips (7 days but could squeeze another day or two depending on what you're doing) with a small daypack for snacks and entertainment. Sturdy material and zippers. While it doesn't stay open like other commenters noted, I haven't used it enough to determine if that's a design flaw or if it's from the bag being packed up in the smaller bag is comes with. 
I do love that the backpack straps stay attached to the bag so you don't have to worry about loosing them like other duffles. The zipper pocket on the front of the bag is hard to get things in and out of when the bag is full but I have that same experience with other duffle so again not a flaw but something of note.
review.name: Love this so much I bought it in more sizes

review.reviewBody: I currently have two (30L/55L) that I purchased back in January 2024. I love them both but find myself using the 30L more often. The overall construction, fit and finish, and color options are very pleasing to me personally. When it comes to, "gear" I love anything that is modular, multi-purpose, or convenient.  The Double Haul Convertibles check all of the boxes for my needs. I am the type of person that wants one of everything, so with that said...I'm sure I'll purchase the other two sizes and in the colors I don't have. So that is awesome. Keep up the amazing products Nemo! I'm a lifelong fan/customer!!!
review.name: Built like a tank!

review.reviewBody: Nemo has a reputation for quality, and this bag does not disappoint! This duffle is awesome. Carrying it as a tote is surprisingly comfortable, even when fully stuffed to the brim. The stitching is solid, and the zippers are sturdy and glide smoothly, a detail that really enhances usability. When using it as a duffle, the straps distribute weight evenly, so they do not dig in and make the bag uncomfortable to wear, which is great for longer treks. There are several pockets, which is great for keeping your items separated including a zippered one which is great for keeping valuables safe. Overall great purchase.
review.name: Awesome duffle & tote bag

review.reviewBody: It is durable and versatile.  However, I don't know when I will use the tote functionality, it is relatively heavy and I would prefer detachable backpack shoulder straps.
review.name: Mixed impressions

review.reviewBody:
I was very impressed with the Convertible Duffel Bag from Nemo. It exceeded my expectations in terms of its versatility and high-quality construction.

The standout feature of this bag is its ability to seamlessly transform from a spacious duffel to a backpack. The hidden backpack straps tuck away neatly when not in use, allowing the bag to maintain a sleek duffel silhouette. But when I need to go hands-free, the backpack straps are easy to access and provide a comfortable, supported carry. I found this convertible design to be incredibly useful, whether I'm commuting to the office, hitting the gym, or packing for a weekend getaway.

Beyond the versatile design, the quality of this duffel bag is top-notch. The heavy-duty nylon fabric is incredibly durable, with reinforced stitching and sturdy zippers that have held up beautifully through frequent use. The large main compartment provides ample space for all my essentials, and the additional interior and exterior pockets help me stay organized. I was also pleasantly surprised by how lightweight the bag is, even when fully loaded.

I've used this convertible duffel extensively over the past few months, taking it with me on both short trips and longer vacations. It's held up remarkably well, maintaining its shape and functionality even when subjected to the challenges of travel. The water-resistant coating has also been a helpful feature, protecting my belongings from the occasional rain shower.

I would highly recommend the Convertible Duffel Bag to anyone looking for a versatile and well-crafted travel companion. Its ability to seamlessly transition between a duffel and backpack, combined with its durable construction and thoughtful design, make it an excellent choice. I'm thoroughly satisfied with my purchase and know this bag will continue to serve me well for years to come.
review.name: Incredibly Versatile and Well-Made Duffel

name: Double Haul Convertible Duffel 30L Bag

review.reviewBody: I love love love love love these pants. I now don't overheat touring or at the resort. They are light and move flexibly. Fit true to size. And the pockets. Oh man. I can fit my phone, keys, ski pass, and all the snacks. Even has a beacon pocket. Love them.
review.name: Best pants ever

review.reviewBody: Size 4 typically, 5'6, 120 lbs and size small were too small, too short from shoulder to crotch and too tight on  legs to comfortably have a warm base layer under. Quality and color were excellent.
review.name: RUNS VERY SMALL!

review.reviewBody:
I own a navy pair of these bibs from a few years ago. I just ordered another pair in a different color to change things up. When I tried them on I thought perhaps I ordered the wrong size as they were hard to zip around the hips. I sat down and they felt snug in the thighs. I compared them to the older pair and they are 1.5" smaller through the waist.

For reference I'm 5-5 138lbs. I ordered a medium. I would suggest trying a few sizes to get the right fit. I ended up sending these back. Grateful backcountry makes returns so easy.
review.name: Runs smaller than previous years

review.reviewBody: Had a coworker (and a #BackcountryGearhead) recommend these bibs to me after I complained that a) nothing fits my hips and b) insulated ski pants are getting too hot for the job. I'm in love. They're crazy waterproof, keeping me comfortable all through the storms and powder we got this year. They're a little snug in the thigh, but not to the point that I felt the need to size up. I wish the bib pocket was a little larger, but the hoodie-style side-entry pockets offer tons of storage, so it all works out. And the double vents are a huge bonus. The bibs, despite not having insulation, are pretty toasty, so it was nice to let air in when I needed it.
review.name: Shell Pants Convert

review.reviewBody:
I bought these after a recommendation from a friend. They are really nice, great pockets, great ventilation options, I love how you can unzip and use the bathroom and take them off without having to finagle the straps over your head. The material is incredibly breathable but fantastic for wind breaking. Used them with only leggings underneath at Mammoth on a 20 degree day (not on purpose the forecast changed), and I was totally fine temperature wise. 

My ONLY issue is I snapped the chest pocket closed and could never unbutton it. I tried to pry it open but the button ripped right out of the pocket material like there was nothing holding it. It's great it won't come undone accidentally, but now I can never close that pocket again because the button is TOO strong. Really disappointed especially for the price point of these pants that something like a stupid pocket button will rip the material. 

Size up because the legs aren't super roomy ( I play volleyball and do outdoors sports and these thighs needed that extra space). I roll mine up at the bottom because I'm also short.
review.name: Broken in 3 uses - still great

review.reviewBody: I struggle to find ski pants so when my old pair got their third rip I dreaded finding a new pair. I had heard great things about Flylow and decided to give them a try. To my surprise my first order is what I went with! I have a slightly curvier athletic build. I bought the size large and it fits great in the leg with some gaping in the waist, but not bad enough to return. The pants have all of the features I need and are quite warm given the lack of insulation. So overall really like the pants would just note sizing is a bit small and probably better for a more straight build.
review.name: Great bib- fit slightly off

name: Moxie Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: It’s a good hat, it’s my first 5 panel style hat and I like a lot more than I thought I would. I have a big head and the strap is still able to be tucked in and not flopping around. It fits well and looks decent. Only gripe is if you sweat in this hat it bleeds right through, one afternoon in the sun and I had a nice salt ring on the brim. That’s just part of the break in process. I’d never heard of Bearded Goat before this purchase but they have cool stuff, I might get a sweatshirt at some point.
review.name: I really like it

review.reviewBody: I like them so much I ordered another pair. Nuff said.
review.name: Great MTB Short

review.reviewBody: These shorts are great. Everything in the right spot, zipper pockets, vents and they have been extremely durable on long o er night trips and at my local park. They do run on the larger size. I ordered a large and xl to make sure I got the right fit. I went with the large but wonder I’d a medium would work. I also ordered the 10inch version and will keep the 10 and 12 inch versions
review.name: Great shorts just work like they should

review.reviewBody: the material is a great choice, should be tough enough and thin enough as well. The pockets are functional and keep your phone on the side of your leg which is nice as well. I picked up two colors and couldn't be happier! Great for hiking as well.
review.name: Best MTB shorts I have ridden

review.reviewBody: I've pedaled with them for several months now. Great so far.
review.name: I love these

review.reviewBody: I have multiple pairs of these and I love them.  Unfortunately my latest pair in the color turbulence has a taped seam on the leg opening that is coming apart. I have only washed these 4 times. Love them but would not recommend them for this reason .
review.name: Great shorts but taped seam failing

review.reviewBody: I bought two pairs of these shorts on a lark and to use for Indoor Climbing.  I like them SO MUCH I wear them constantly.  I work remotely doing Consultative Sales; so I sit in front of three monitors and a laptop all day.  These are BY FAR the most comfortable shorts to work in! Gonna add a couple more colors for the Summer. Ladies take note: The "gusset" in these shorts is tailored in such a way that, if you get a kick out of glancing at your man's "credentials" once in a while, you're gonna especially like these badboys LOL.  My normally aloof wife was the one who called this "feature" to my attention; and SHE was the one who suggested I grab a couple more pairs!
review.name: Don't MTB, but DO wear these Badboys!

review.reviewBody: These are one of the most comfortable MTB shorts I've owned. They are lightweight, cool, and super comfortable material. I wear padded liner shorts under, so I love the adjustable built in waistband belt to secure the fit. . Highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome lightweight shorts

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn these for three weeks now, having bought two pairs initially and later adding a third. They run on the tighter side of being true-to-size in my opinion. I’m 180 and 5’ 11” and a M fits pretty much like a glove, the thighs being the absolute smallest diameter I would want them. A L might be baggy, and were I ten pounds heavier I would certainly upsize. The quality is there. The fabric has really grown on me these past few weeks. The pockets easily fit a larger cell phone and I’ve had no issues whatsoever with constrictions or binding. The vents are so helpful, and they were the feature that helped coax me into buying the first two pair. The quality of construction and the feel of the fabric and the perfect fit all combined to convince me to get a third pair for better laundry rotation in hot weather. Overall a solid product for my first experience with Backcountry brand. I’ll be giving their other products a closer look from now on as my needs warrant. It does seem that Backcountry listens to user feedback when designing their gear - at least as far as these shorts are concerned.
review.name: Exactly What I Needed for Summer

review.reviewBody: This is a very comfortable biking shorts without lining. It fits me great and the material feels nice. I've got it in 3 colors now.
review.name: Excellent biking shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts look better in person than on photos. And so lightweight. Really good product
review.name: WOW!

name: Slickrock 11in Bike Short - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Squall Shell Jacket - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for an improvement over my Castelli Superleggera which I felt was a bit porous. The Squall jacket fits exactly like the Superlegerra did (same sizing, IMO), and it definitely blocks the wind. I have to assume it would block the rain as well, but I generally avoid wet rides. And given this jacket really blocks the wind, I find it's a bit warmer than my previous one, and that's probably because it doesn't breathe as much, which means I sweat a bit more under the Squall. But it does the job! And the fabric is very stretchy.

I'm 6 feet tall, 64.6kg, with long arms, so sleeve length on this jacket was important. With the Medium, I have about 1.5-2in of extra fabric at my wrists and the arms are a bit flappy. With the Small, the sleeves are still just long enough and more form fitting, as is the chest, letting in less wind at the wrists and neck. Packs up really small.

I've used the Medium a few times now and it works really well albeit it's a bit loose at the chest and down the sleeves. Easily fits over stuffed jersey pockets.

I also ended-up with a Small. I'm not sure the Small would stretch enough to fit over 3 jersey pockets stock full of bars/gels/phone/spares/etc for a really long ride, but it's fine for shorter rides with pockets that aren't so full (maybe 3 bars and 3 gels, and a few accessories), and it's slimmer at the chest and down the sleeves, which is is nice when facing the wind.

"True to [Castelli] size"...
review.name: Cuts the wind

name: Squall Shell Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: Merino 250 Balaclava - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smartwool Merino 250 Balaclava - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This thing is great! We got it for my 2.5 year old to wear under his bike helmet. His head is 20", if that's helpful for other potential buyers. I was concerned that he wouldn't be able to pull the lower part down under his chin, but that's no problem. Also, for what it's worth, the balaclava is stretchy enough to fit my adult sized head comfortably, so I'm sure we'll have this thing forever. It's great quality and very warm.
review.name: Great for my toddler!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this balaclava. Fits perfect for my son. He's 3 but wears size 2T clothes. Fits around goggles nicely.
review.name: Great for the winter

review.reviewBody: Boiled wool, thin and practical. What can be better on a human skin?
review.name: Best balaclava ever

review.reviewBody: Love it. A little thicker than what we are used to, but fits great and can be worn as hood or balaclava by 4 yr old.
review.name: Good buy

review.reviewBody: Great BALACLAVA . #sweepstakes
review.name: Great BALACLAVA

review.reviewBody: this is a gift for my grandson, haven't given it yet...seems great, good looking and nice weight
review.name: i guess so...wouldn't mind having one for myself

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's the best balaclava hat I've found in years. I love it that it's not too thick and not too thin. It's thick and warm enough to actually serve as a hat in cold weather yet it's thin enough to be layered underneath a cute hat on VERY cold weather. I like it that it's very snug around the face. I wish it were a bit stretchier so a kid can pull it down like a gaiter when indoors but I guess that's why it's so snug around the face.
review.name: Goldilocks of balaclava hats- thick&warm yet can be layered

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This fits great and our son loves it! It's lightweight and fits perfectly under his bike and ski helmets for some added warmth!
review.name: Fits like at glove!

review.reviewBody: Needed a wool balaclava for my 8yr old underneath a ski helmet. Fits perfectly and just the right thickness.
review.name: Brilliant Balaclava for kids

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my daughter. She loves it!! Her favorite ski jacket.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Runs large, but so cute! Great for layering and got lots of compliments!
review.name: Worth it, 100%

review.reviewBody: This is amazing. I liked the look and feel of the material
review.name: Loved it

review.reviewBody: So many compliments! Gorgeous color. Great warmth as well. Runs slightly large. I'm 5'7 and 135 and I went with a small and debated sizing down for both jacket and pants.
review.name: Would buy again!

review.reviewBody: Super cute a little slimmer in the arms then expected which would make layering a little difficult but I still wouldn’t size up. I love that it’s longer and doesn’t ride up when sitting on the lift. Personal favorite features is the phone cord and belt. I’m 5’5 135 and ordered a small. Only took off one star for the zipper being a little difficult and not a ton of room for layering but overall worth the cost!
review.name: Worth the money!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best ski jacket I’ve ever owned.  Warm, functional and flattering.
review.name: Winner!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight but has kept me so warm in 12 degree weather that I actually had to take a layer off underneath the jacket! I had to size down from a medium to a small but worth the weight for the exchange
review.name: Stylish and functional! 10/10 purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am absolutely obsessed with my Halfdays outfit. I was looking for a comfortable, warm, well made ski jacket and this is it! I got it in a 1x and I’m a size 16/18 and it fit great. It truly made me feel comfortable on the slopes and I’m excited to wear my cute fit for years to come. Thank you Halfdays for being size inclusive at a reasonable price point for great quality skiwear.
review.name: Exactly what I wanted

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so happy with this jacket, it truly proved to surpass any other ski jacket I have ever worn! It kept me comfortably warm in both cold power days & bluebird sunny climates. The features are incredibly high quality like the zippers, the belt that made me feel so feminine, & the hood that could be tightened in many ways. Highly recommend! So much love for this company!
review.name: Love Love Love!

review.reviewBody: I was so incredibly happy with this jacket, I was able to ski comfortably warm in a range of climates & snow! I felt so feminine & classy with the belt detail & love the quality of the zippers. I got so many compliments on the color too! My friends never lost me on the mountain either do due its bright color!
review.name: Love Love Love

description: Buy the Thule Accent 23L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Accent 23L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Accent 23L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: A year later and after so many business trips, this backpack still looks brand new. It is compact, accessible, and stylish. My go-to option for 2-4 day business trips. The main highlight for me is the exterior fabric material - no smudges or scratches, easy to wipe off, and just looks fresh. Overall, highly recommended.
review.name: Business traveller approved

review.reviewBody: Bought it a month ago. And no regret buying the bag
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: I have used this bag twice for weekend trips and the internal mesh pocket has already ripped. I have had a Thule backpack for 10 years and never had a problem until and finally decided to get a new one. Sad to see the quality diminish like this.
review.name: Terrible Quality

review.reviewBody: Bought this backpack for professional travel, looking for lightness with enough space, and a design that could be paired with a suit, and this was spot on. Light and roomy, with no more straps and pockets than a regular person would need. Good padding for the laptop, and convenient front-top protected pouch.
review.name: Light and versatile

review.reviewBody: It was finally time to replace my old Thule backpack I received as a gift from my previous boss around 10 years ago. The hard case glasses zipper had finally given up due to me partially opening it and removing items, over stressing the seam. Everything else is still going strong and it will be my back up. I did a lot of looking around, but ultimately came back to Thule. The hard case glasses pocket and the small side pocket where I keep my garage door opener for easy access on the motorcycle made the Accent backpack the obvious choice.
review.name: Perfect replacement to my old Thule backpack

name: Accent 23L Backpack

review.reviewBody: This is my 6th pair of salomon speedcross shoes and I have no plans for buying any other shoe.  I use them for everything from playing with my kids to climbing mountains.  The debris mesh keeps most of the june grass seeds out of my socks.  The quick lace makes this shoe a transformer.  It goes from a causal shoe that goes one easy then you tighten the lace and you are ready for a 25 mile day in the backcountry.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: I have been using these shoes to climb all over the granite in my neighborhood.  The sole grip is amazing.
review.name: Comfotable shoes with great grip

review.reviewBody: Great product! very good shoes, in the rain is excelent!
review.name: Great product! very good shoes
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the Black / Phantom version of this shoe.
They fit me great and they are extremely comfortable and practical.  I have no complaints about the shoe itself or the way it performs.

However, be aware that, at least in my case, the product I received was not exactly as depicted by the pictures on the website.  The pictures show the "Black / Phantom" version as having a solid black top.  The shoes I received have the "Speedcross 6" stamped in huge letters across the entire shoe. - You would think it is not a great deal, but it effectively prevents me from wearing them in some circumstances.
review.name: Great shoe! - I wish the pictures were accurate

review.reviewBody: I've been getting through 2 pairs of Speedcross a year since the 3s and I think for me, these are the worst. I run a lot in wet UK conditions and struggling with this model. There's too much movement in the toe box (I nearly cut my circulation off tightening to compensate) so I've lost a lot of confidence on downhills and technical terrain. Also felt as though the soles are more flexible so ended up feeling quite bruised under foot. 4ls are still the best, I'll be staying to snag a couple of pairs.
review.name: You had me at 4's
comment:
Hi Mark! 
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. 
We often make adjustments to our products based on direct customer feedback. We will be sure to pass on your feedback to the relevant department. 
We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing Salmon shoes for over 20 years. My speed cross 6 is my go to shoe. I know my size and be confident they will always fit correctly
review.name: my favorite go to shoe for years.

review.reviewBody:
Intermediate trail runner, needed high drop shoes (achilles issues) with good grip for grass/mud marathon. Tried them on a 25k trail run, mixed terrain. Traction on grass and mud is absolutely superb, and they don't accumulate mud. Compared to my road to trail Pegasus trail it's a world apart. They feel very precise and stable on the descents. But they are somewhat narrow and have a high arch on the inside of the foot. Ended up giving me minor pain on the outside of the peroneus tendon, probably should have gotten the wide version. Also shoes are ok but a bit uncomfortable on rocks (not what they're for) as you can feel every rock under your feet. On road they're surprisingly okay despite the huge lugs, a few kms left no visible damage to the lugs. Seem well built overall.

Takeaway: if you're looking for precise technical shoes with absolute max traction on mud/grass with high drop and somewhat reasonable cushioning, they're perfect. But ideally try them out in a shop first as the shape is opiniated.
review.name: Do their job well but fit is surprising

review.reviewBody: I’m a size 14.  Have tried multiple shoes as I prep for my PCT thru hike next March.  I’ve been using my Salomon Speedcross 6 pair for a month and they are perfect.  Sturdy, light, and beyond comfortable.  I just ordered three more pairs to family can forward them to me.
review.name: Speedcross 6 is amazing

review.reviewBody: I don’t use them for running but I do/will use them for trail walking and hiking. They are light and comfortable. An excellent buy if I may say so myself 😁
review.name: Trail walking

review.reviewBody: I've had these for over a year, and I've worn them at work, hiking, traveling, road running, every day I've beaten the crap out of them and they are by far, the best shoe I've worn for my wide feet. I've had less back problems because of these, and my only problem with them is the fact that I've worn through the sole in just this year from how much I've used them. I'm on my second pair, and I'm glad to have bought them.
review.name: Perfect grey man shoe

review.reviewBody: Excellent sleeping bag liner, very comfortable. I have only tested it in warmer weather with a summer weight sleeping bag. The sleeping bag was quickly opened up and I just used the liner with the sleeping bag acting more like a quilt. Temps dropped to 13degC and I was comfortable but I do sleep warm. Hoping to use the liner to extend the range of my summer sleeping bag until it gets cold enough to use my Sonic 0degF (-18C) bag.
review.name: Great addition to my sleep system.

review.reviewBody: Fits my Riff bag perfectly, keeps it clean, and has just enough stretch!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Very nice sleeping bag, kept me very comfortable on a 2 night 3 day hike mostly on the AT but up to the summit of Mt Roger’s in Virginia. Absolutely no problems and light in my pack!
review.name: Awesome Sleeping Bag

hasVariant.name: Terragrip Sandal - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Teva Terragrip Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I just received my sandals yesterday and absolutely love them. They are so comfortable on my feet! Thank you so much to Grace in customer service for expediting my exchange. I am truly grateful for the speedy delivery. Suzanne Marchetti
review.name: I will buy Teva's again in the future.

review.reviewBody: I wanted a disney shoe for when it rains or water rides. I didn't even wear them 2 hours before I noticed the shoe pushes my pinkie toe into the next toenail. Shoe gives u bad blisters. I wore them in the water in the bahamas. Cut my toe on a reef so no protection. And every tiny rock got stuck in the shoe under my feet and the only way to get them out was to take the shoe off. Ended the day with so many blisters between my toes again. I can't think of anywhere now I'm going to wear these. Sigh. I had high hopes for these. Expensive shoes I don't know if I'll even wear.
review.name: I don't want to wear these for anywhere

review.reviewBody: I received these shoes in April of 2024, and by July 2024 my all black Hydratrek sandals have turned brown along the straps. I contacted customer support to see if they could be replaced with the warranty, and they told me that discoloration is to be expected and they would not be accepted for warranty. I wish I had the ability to attach a photo with this review, because the color change is drastic and hard to imagine without seeing .
review.name: Major discoloration after only 3 months

review.reviewBody: Why are the neoprene liners under the straps not fully sewn in? So if you put your foot in they double over and fold, so you have to reach in the make them each flat. At least two of them. This makes no sense to me...just why this extra work on our end every time you put them on? This is the only reason i am thinking about sending them back....
review.name: Neoprene liners not fully sewn in?

review.reviewBody: I bought these sandals to wear as everyday sandals for summer. Great color to go with my summer clothing. Soft and supportive under foot. Even able to wear to work and on my feet on concrete for 8+ hrs. Definitely recommend. I'm normally a 9.5 women's but bought a 9 and they are perfect.
review.name: Love the hydratrek sandal

review.reviewBody: The extra padding on these is game changing. These are so comfortable for long extended walking/ hiking/ summer activities. They do not rub my feet. Love them.
review.name: Game changer

review.reviewBody: Wish I had them last couple of years. I have had foot and hip pain the I just kinda dismissed as getting older but after wearing these shoes for a couple od days, both hip and feet felt normal again. Love them cause I can water my plants and let them get wet and they look wonderful. Love the blue pattern
review.name: great shoes!!

review.reviewBody: LOVE my Tevas. I actually saw Maia Knight post these on her Instagram story. And I'm so thankful I did! I got a blister from breaking them in, but it was totally worth it. I wear these every single day. I have tried SO many different brands. Teva Hydratrek are by far my favorite! I wont buy any other brand again!
review.name: I wont buy another sandal again!

review.reviewBody: I'm a kayak and canoe enthusiast so I find myself getting in and out of water situations all the time. The Hydratrek sandals are about as comfortable as you would expect from the brand. They're cushy and the extra grip gives you a false sense of security when you're walking along slick surfaces. However, on wet trails, clay and mud get jammed in the sole crevices, so it can become a slippery situation...and definitely don't let the mud sit and dry because it's hard to clean. The little neoprene covers under the buckles are a nice touch. They prevent your big and little toes from water blisters, but if you throw your sandals on haphazardly, the ones on the inside ankles tend to bend back and get stuck in an uncomfortable way...you have to be mindful of them when you strap in. Like all Teva sandals, when I'm walking in water, all the pebbles and small rocks find their way under my arch...and it is such a pain to try to remove them...you pretty much have to stop and loosen the top strap to get in there to remove the rocks. It's such a drag when you're portaging in flowing water and you can't immediately stop to get the rocks out. I'm a little disappointed that the strap material is standard Teva strapping...I was hoping these would be quick drying since these are a water sandal, but nah, they take about 2 hrs in full afternoon sun to get the topside of the straps mostly dry. And the underside is always still moist. For overnight camping, they are most definitely cold and wet at 5am. Will I keep buying Teva even though I'm always slightly disappointed when I have them in adventure mode? Yes...because they're comfortable and they look good.
review.name: Elevated Grip

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing these for distance walking and casual. Very comfortable!
review.name: Very comfortable!

name: Terragrip Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] On website has many designs to choose from. Had gave it to a friend that does field work. He told me the fit was the perfect snug around his eyes to see clearly with great stretching material.
review.name: Perfect thing to wear to protect breathing in dirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this as a gift for my nephew. Perfect for this weather for this time of year. It’s so cute and stretchy so it has a good comfortable wear to it under his coat.
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: My boys love the prints, and it makes it easy to find when digging through a sea of black ski gear.  The fits if perfect for my 7-year-olds.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is the perfect fit for my 5 year old! He is so excited he has already used it multiple times to stay warm at recess with our snow storms. It is soft and easy for him to get on and off by himself! This is a great product and he loves the pattern.
review.name: Great Product!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My kiddo doesn't like to be too hot or too sweaty, and I believe he won't have that problem!
Also, this can replace 3 things: a hat, scarf, and earmuffs, very satisfied.
review.name: Comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits my grandson perfectly. He’s 2.5 years old and has a large build. Super durable to get on and off, will definitely stop the wind and cold from coming through while outside playing! Great design as well!!!
review.name: Awesome !!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Ski Mask is amazing! It looked to big to fit a tiny toddled, but it fit my 2 year old nephew perfectly! It has a nice stretch, and it is gery breathable. It keeps his ears, neck, and nose warm perfectly!!! Love love love this brand!
review.name: Kid friendly!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product. Quality is excellent. Fit is to size! It is warm and looks great! Material is nice and soft making it very comfortable to wear. Nice product!
review.name: Great quality! Very nice design!

review.reviewBody: My 3 kids ages 3,4, and 6 all love to wear these! We needed something for them to ski with here in Oregon, but also wanted something they’d wear out that would cover their face because of COVID. It’s serving a dual purpose and we couldn’t be happier, even with the warmer weather they are comfy and protected! Great product!
review.name: So happy with this product!!!

review.reviewBody: Purchased two kids balaclavas for the2021 ski season. Dual purpose face covering to meet mask requirements and to keep faces protected from wind and cold. Kids are comfortable wearing over face throughout the day without complaint! Well worth it!
review.name: Love these Balaclavas!

name: Print Hood Balaclava - Kids'

review.reviewBody: Over the years, I have gradually upgraded my indoor game from the old school turbo trainer, the hydraulic trainer, the high end smart trainer, and now the Wahoo Shift Bike. Unboxing and set up was a snap (utilizing Wahoo's instructional video). After a few rides totaling 150+ miles, it is by far the most sophisticated ride feel I've experienced. The bike is well constructed, has a very smooth pedal stoke, and is nearly silent while riding. Paired with Zwift, it has performed perfectly. High price = High expectations and Wahoo has delivered!
review.name: For Indoor Cycling Enthusiasts

name: KICKR SHIFT Indoor Training Bike

review.reviewBody: I use these for wehn the temps in the 40'sF. They also have padding in the palm. They fit well and are super comfortable and warm if used in dry conditions. These are not waterproof. I had these on and got caught in a rainstorm and they soaked through. Another issue is I've used these through 2 seasons and the cuff is starting to unravel where I pull the glove on. I do like them and use them often and the glove portion seems super durable. They are perfect to pack in a pocket for when temps may drop during a ride. I am worried about the cuff falling apart eventually. I;ve include a pic of the cuff.
review.name: Great Spring/Fall gloves

name: All Weather Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, warm, good protection from wind and light rain. Generous fit.
review.name: Recommend

review.reviewBody: It was a Christmas gift - he wore it the next day and was happy with my choice.
review.name: Christmas gift

review.reviewBody: My Men's Rain Defender insulated jacket is a serious upgrade from the NorthFace jacket I recently purchased. The quality of materials and construction, as well as the convenience of the various pockets for important things like my glasses, wallet and phone, makes me wonder why anyone would choose the other brand over Carhart.
review.name: Carhart beats NorthFace

review.reviewBody: I have a black one as well, which has been I go-to for a few years. It's a nice weight and works well with light layering.
As advertised, perfect fit, usual excellent quality!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I wanted a light weight, water resistant jacket that was easy to pull on and off over flannel shirts. This jacket was a perfect fit for all my needs
I love this coat. I have it in 3 different colors. It is warm and very comfortable.  Very up scale look to it. I wear it with dress pants and jeans. A must have in your coat selection.
review.name: A must have coat.

review.reviewBody: Jacket is okay, not as thick or warm as seemed but nice nonetheless. Size runs large.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: Nice fit. Light weight because I don't wear heavy jackets. Perfect for me.
review.name: Jacket

review.reviewBody: I've been trying to get a return label for two days, jacket needs to be returned due to size and get the correct size. I had return label in my order!!
review.name: Not good at this point

name: Gilliam Insulated Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Black Diamond 6.0 Static Rope online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 6.0 Static Rope
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond 6.0 Static Rope online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This 6.0mm accessory cord has worked perfectly for mountaineering prussiks. It also handles very well. I cut off a bit for hauling and it works nicely in this role as well.
I highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent for Mountaineering and Hauling

review.reviewBody: Love the cord and quality. We used this to make a few 3 m cordage ropes for utility for my wife and kids.
review.name: Trusted cord

review.reviewBody: I'm intending to use this as a cordelette. It is incredibly stiff out of the package. I've run it loaded through a belay device two or three times to a little loosening up, but it's still too stiff to want to use outdoors.
review.name: Super Stiff

review.reviewBody: I bought this rope for tag lining my drill up mostly, but have been using it to pull line on my rappels and it is perfect!!! Super light, and stowes away perfect in a bullet pack. No more climbing with a back Pack coil just to double rope rappel a route. This totally fixed my issues!!
review.name: Perfect line

review.reviewBody: Very stiff cord. Haven’t got to use it yet but I anticipate it will loosen up.
review.name: Very stiff cord. Haven’t got

review.reviewBody: The length 65m is perfect, the sheath is tight and burly. This line serves multiple purposes. It is my emergency Lift Evac line when I am ski Patrolling, it is a tad longer than my 60m climbing rope, handy for 100+ foot routes and getting off multi pitch routes that have rap stations set up for 2 60m ropes. I use it for single-patient loads (pt is in a sked or other litter) where a quick belay on steep terrain ads a safety factor. I like the black color!
review.name: 6mm Static Tag Line

review.reviewBody:
This is very stiff cord. Stiffer than powercord. About as stiff or even more stiff than Sterling Xtec. It doesn't take knots especially easily because of the stiffness.
Also it's not clear what this is made of, which is unsettling. I don't know why BD doesn't name the materials used.
If you are looking for stiff cord with what seems to be a nylon sheath, and are looking for something lightweight but not especially compressible because of the stiffness, then this cord seems just fine. It's a 5/5 if you want very stiff thin cord for a good price.
review.name: Very Stiff

review.reviewBody: Good quality and as described, never any issues with my BD gear
review.name: GREAT CORD

review.reviewBody: I was so glad you had this short cord . I got on my climbing wall to check it out. Its so stiff and thin. I have a hard time gripping this its so thin. I sent the full length cord back and ordered the 9 m . thanks
review.name: I was so glad you

review.reviewBody:
Hey BD, 

Unfortunately I instantly regretted my purchase of the 65m 6.0mm tag line. The cord is the stiffest static rope I have ever handled. It is painful to work with and will be even more frustrating to pack for climbing trips. 

I would really recommend making it a more supple piece of rope. I would not recommend it to anyone.
review.name: Far too stiff

name: 6.0 Static Rope

description: Buy the Trango Eurotape online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Eurotape
hasVariant.description: Buy the Trango Eurotape online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought 15 of these for rock climbing because my local supplier ran out when I had an imminent trip planned.  The first 7 arrived early and made my trip much easier!  They have been perfect for reinforcing tendons and protecting my hands while crack climbing.  This tape performs up to the standards I expect from Mueller Eurotape.  The last 8 rolls never arrived.  FedEx failed to deliver them to my apartment, and Backcountry failed to contact me about the shipment problem.  They ended up at a FedEx office in another town 30 minutes away and were shipped to Mississippi for disposal within 5 days of arriving in Illinois.  I wasn't able to visit the FedEx office before my last 8 rolls were shipped away because I was in the backcountry rock climbing with the first roll of tape.  I highly recommend this tape!  But I wouldn't trust FedEx express delivery again unfortunately.
review.name: Right product, but shipping issues

name: Eurotape

review.reviewBody:
I have 5 days of skiing on the jacket in weather from sunny/warm to heavy snow. The fabric breathability is perfect for sidecountry/in-bounds skiing, but a touch heavy if you're looking for a backcountry jacket. Great windproofing while still breathing. 

I am 5'11, 165lbs, with broad shoulders. I bought the medium and it can be worn with a puffy underneath comfortably. Not baggy, but still free range of movement. A touch more room on the shoulders would have suited me a bit better.

There are a ton of useful pockets, no shortage. Zippers are easy to access, pit zips are a bit cumbersome however. Velcro on the cuffs is easy to adjust with different gloves.
review.name: Another quality jacket from MH

review.reviewBody: Bought for my brother for snowboard trip upstate. Nice fit features and color
review.name: Like it

review.reviewBody: Amazing shell…Don’t waste your time thinking about it …..Just do it
review.name:
Worth every dime….Top quality products across the board. The fit is a little big as I usually buy large, but the med was just right and I could still layer appropriately and comfortably. The stitching was perfect and the look is just what I wanted. 
GREAT

name: First Tracks Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My left foot loves these shoes. However the right foot pokes into my forefoot where the toes bend and it has bruised my foot. I tried to have them warrantied, but Sorel just said the case was closed. I have 6 other pairs of sorel boots and don't have this problem in any of them.
review.name: Almost great
comment: Hello Hrey, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are very comfortable and I loved them until they started leaking. I thought Sorel had a better product than this. The glue used along the top of the boot has pulled away and now the boot leaks in rain or snow. For only wearing them a occasionally throughout two years, I am shocked this company does not stand behind their product but instead insists on a 'one year limited life-time' warranty. Sad for Sorel as you will continue to lose customers
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Hello Sgreen, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have loved these boots for over a year. They are warm, very comfortable and the color I have, black and sparkly silver is so cute. 

Unfortunately, the shoe is coming unglued from the sole and the trim is coming unglued.  It is incredibly disappointing as I expect better quality from Sorel.
review.name: Not holding up over time
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have always loved this brand and have been wearing my last pair for a few years.  Happy to share this arrived in great condition and looks exactly as pictured on site   The boots is attractive and comfortable.  I do wish the brand would make wide width options.
review.name: Great purchase

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Box arrived damaged and the tan pair arrived with several scuffs on them, appearing to have been worn. 
The boots themselves are pretty cute. I like last year’s version much more though. Ordered half a size up because last year’s were a little snug in my normal size. These are almost too big, they fit weird and are heavier.  
The black and chalk ones - the rubber lower portion is a tan yellow, NOT off white like the photos make them appear. Likely returning.
review.name: Not in love
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore for less than 10 hours and the rubber sole split from the shoe. Thought maybe it was a one off but then happened with a different pair of the same shoe. Bring back the out & about 1, the quality is worse with the redesign
review.name: Poor quality since redesign, sole came off less than 10 hours into first wrar
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots.  Not great for winter in the north woods but definitely a great mud boot… waterproofing is amazing and they are so very cute!!! Love them ♥️
review.name: Love these Boots

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots! They are super comfy and durable!
review.name: Great Boots!

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: LOVE these!  All day comfort and cute! Order 1/2 size up.
review.name: Order 1/2 size up!  Adorable boots that are actually comfortable!  Love these with barrel leg overalls!

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Felt Suede WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved these boots initially. I bought them in the fall of October 2023 and I live in Michigan. This year when I took them out of winter storage I noticed that the toe is separating and water now can seep in. I’m disappointed because they are barely out of warranty and I only wore them for roughly 6 months out of the year. Not sure if I received a lemon but it’s making me think twice about purchasing Sorel boots
review.name: Loved but they didn’t last a year
comment: Hello lo2345, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Equipe RS S11 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent compression and comfort. Great pad. Superb moisture wicking. As good for 100K+ as for shorter rides.
review.name: Very happy

review.itemreviewed: Equipe RS S11 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very breathable chamois makes for amazing comfort and no swamping on long hot rides. Awesome leg grippers and the secure fit NEVER have me readjusting so I don't have to worry about chaffing or saddle sores. I've never had a bib that fits this good and I look forward to every ride I do in these. Will be getting another pair ASAP so I can have these constantly in rotation over the summer.
review.name: Top Notch Quality and Comfort

review.itemreviewed: Equipe RS S11 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
My previous Assos bibs were the S9 and I wasn't a huge fan. When I saw these S11's I figured I'd give them another chance. I am SOOOOO glad I did. These bibs are perfect! I got the longer-leg version because I am 6'1" and I like bib shorts that cover more of my skin. The biggest upgrade over the S9 for me is the leg grippers on the back of the raw-cut leg openings. Way more comfy than the legs on the S9! 

The X-frame bib strap keeps the chamois where you want it. And the chamois is super comfy. Has the features we've come to love with the brand. I can't wait for some all-day summer rides in these bib shorts. They are so light and breathable that summer riding should be ultra comfortable. 

Pro tip: Pair these with the new S11 jersey and you will be looking pro!
review.name: Worth it!

name: Equipe RS S11 Long Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission 90L Duffel online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mission 90L Duffel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission 90L Duffel online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago. Love it! However, I will be returning it because the snaps on the handles do not snap securely. They are the only reason I’m not giving five stars. I love everything else about this duffle. Just wish the snaps were of equal quality to the rest of the bag.
review.name: Great duffle…but

review.reviewBody: Love this duffel especially for river and camping trips. I purchased the 90L, so when it's loaded up, it can be a bit heavy to haul around, but I love how spacious it is and how easy it is to fold up as an extra carry on if I go shopping where I travel. The 60L may have been more practical, but I don't like feeling overstuffed, so I am happy with the size I chose.
review.name: Great bag, it's massive!

review.reviewBody: This duffel bag is considerably lighter than all my other duffel bags.  Considering its made by MR, I have no doubt it is stronger too.  The coated fabric is really nice for light splashes and such.  I don't believe the zippers are waterproof, but this is not supposed to be a dry bag.  The zippers do seem very durable and likely to take a lot of abuse.  This is my new favorite duffel bag.
review.name: Light and Durable!

review.reviewBody: This bag holds 1 pair of pants a pair of sweatpants 4 shortsleeved t shirts 2 long sleeve t shirts 6 pairs of underwear 6 pair of socks a 12 inch by 7 inch shaving bag in the main compartment one side carries chargers and backup batteries the other side carries 4 med bottles. It’s perfect for me
review.name: Just the right size

review.reviewBody: Well thought out, and great quality, except for the snaps on the grab handle which don’t stay snapped!
review.name: Nice bag!

review.reviewBody: I travel to work and spend on average 96hrs there. I like that there is a compartment to put my dirty clothes although I think that compartment could be a little larger. The overall design is great and there are enough zippered pockets to separate my gear the way I like. Quality of materials and build quality appear on par with other Mystery Ranch products and I anticipate this to be a durable product.
review.name: Great Design

review.reviewBody:
40L, slate gray : 
Have used this pack on a few trips both in the US and internationally. There are some things I love about it but some gripes as well. 

Pros: 
- Great material, abrasion resistant and sturdy. Great stitching
- Not a shell but definitely holds shape well
- perfect carry on size
- good open main compartment with a few mesh internal pockets
- best use with packing cubes

Cons:
- backpack straps are not removable, would love to be  able to use front storage when I don’t need that way of carry 
- easily stained, just the nature of the fabric, not a deal breaker for me 
- would appreciate a brighter color way for the interior so see contents a bit better
review.name: Solid bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag as a present for my son.  He travels quite a bit with some minor camera gear and clothes.  He has told me that this bag fits all his needs for his short weekend jobs. Camera gear, small tripod, 3 days of clothes and toiletries all fit no problem.  Fits in the overhead and he loves the backpack straps option.  He has commented on the quality of the bag, the confidence he has in the zippers and its overall design. Strong work MR!!
review.name: Birthday present getting rave reviews

review.reviewBody: I bought this to transport my skydiving gear to and from the drop zone. Big enough to hold the right and the helmet in its own bag, plus all the accessories and gear. Great quality and rugged.
review.name: Perfect Size for Skydiving Gear

review.reviewBody: I love how this bag was designed for maximum space use. Comfortable to carry and a lot goes into this bag.
review.name: Compartmentalizing at its finest

name: Mission 90L Duffel

review.reviewBody: It is so frustrating that I can not get  this watch to connect to my phone dispute doing every single troubleshooting step.

review.reviewBody: Button doesn’t work in the new one and now I need to wait til they gone fix that.

comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the fenix 8 - 47mm AMOLED. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: When the watch face dims, it is 100% unreadable. Sadly, this hasn't been fixed, likely because it will effect the advertised battery life. Whatever the case, there is no one who has been able to read my watch, myself included, without having to bring it right up to your eyes, like someone suffering from blindness. My old Fenix 4, which this one replaced, is easily readable. Garmin, you have 24 days left to fix this or it's getting returned.
review.name: When the watch face dims, the time is unreadable.
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the fenix 8. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: The watch is buggy even with the latest bugfixes. Haptic feedback doesn't work at some apps, crashed a few times already, the battery shows hours of unmeasured results, youtube music is unavailable. Will wait a week and return the watch if I won't see any progress.
review.name: Full of bugs
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the fenix 8. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: I just spent 3 hours trying to get this watch set up. Online instructions have not been helpful. Not happy with watch faces - unable to figure out how to change or modify data fields. Cannot sync with Garmin bike radar.
review.name: Challenging set up

name: fenix 8 AMOLED Sapphire Sport Watch
